…Abu Dharr, and say to him: 'Uthman sends his greetings to you and says to you: 'Here are two hundred dinars, use them to help you with what has befallen you.' Abu Dharr said: 'Has anyone among the Muslims been given the like of what I have been given?' They said: 'No.' He said: 'But I am just a man from among the Muslims, I am sufficed by what suffices the Muslims.' They said to him: 'He says this is from the core of his wealth, and by Allah, there is no god but He, no unlawful (ḥarām) element has mixed with it, and I have only sent it to you from lawful (ḥalāl) sources.' He said: 'I have no need of it, for I have begun this day and I am among the richest of people.' They said to him: 'May Allah grant you well-being and set you right! We see neither little nor much in your house of what one can enjoy?' He said: 'Indeed, under this ____________________
...and he is not Ja'far ibn Ma'ruf al-Samarqandi, who was mentioned by Ahmad ibn al-Husayn al-Ghadha'iri, who said: 'His kunya is Abu al-Fadl, al-'Ayyashi narrates from him a lot.'
And al-Hasan ibn 'Ali ibn al-Nu'man, ṣaḥīḥ al-ḥadīth (authentic in hadith), has a book of great benefit, as al-Najashi said (1). And in his stratum is who narrates from him al-Saffar and Ahmad ibn Abi 'Abd Allah al-Barqi. And his father, 'Ali ibn al-Nu'man al-A'lam Abu al-Hasan al-Nakha'i, their mawla from Kufa, one of the companions of Abi al-Hasan al-Ridha, peace be upon him, thiqa thabt (trustworthy and steadfast), a prominent figure, ṣaḥīḥ al-ḥadīth (authentic in hadith), clear in his path, and he is the one mentioned in the isnād (chains of narration) of the Psalms of the family of Muhammad and the Gospel of the People of the House, the noble Sahifa Sajjadiyya; Muhammad ibn al-Husayn ibn Abi al-Khattab and Muhammad ibn Abi 'Abd Allah narrate his book from him.
And 'Ali ibn Abi Hamza al-Thumali, not al-Bata'ini, because 'Ali ibn al-Nu'man al-A'lam narrated from him more frequently.
And Abu Basir is Layth ibn al-Bakhtari al-Muradi, and he is called: Abu Basir al-Asghar, not Yahya ibn al-Qasim al-Makfuf, due to the narration of Ibn Abi Hamza al-Thumali from him, so the path is pure and good with 'Ali ibn Abi Hamza, but rather ṣaḥīḥ (authentic) as you will learn, God Almighty willing.
His saying, may God be pleased with him: 'under this *al-ʾIkāf*'. The *ʾIkāf* of the donkey, with a kasrah on the hamza, is well-known. And in al-Qamus: And with a dhamma as well (2).

text:
الأكاف التي ترون رغيفا شعير قد أتي عليهما أيام فما أصنع بهذه الدنانير، لا والله حتى يعلم الله اني لا أقدر على قليل ولا كثير، ولقد أصحبت غنيا بولاية علي بن أبي طالب عليه السلام وعترته الهادين المهديين الراضين المرضيين الذين يهدون بالحق وبه يعدلون، وكذلك سمعت رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله يقول، فإنه لقبيح بالشيخ أن يكون كذابا، فرداها عليه وأعلماه أنه لا حاجة فيها ولا فيما عنده، حتى ألقى الله ربي فيكون هو الحاكم فيما بيني وبينه.
54 - حدثني علي بن محمد القتيبي، قال حدثني الفضل بن شاذان، قال حدثني أبي، عن علي بن الحكم، عن موسى بن بكر، قال قال أبو الحسن عليه السلام قال أبو ذر: من جزى الله عنه الدنيا خيرا فجزاها الله عني مذمة بعد رغيفي شعير أتغدى بأحدهما وأتعشى بالآخر، وبعد شملتي صوف أتزر باحديهما وأرتدي بالأخرى.
____________________
 والأكاف: صانعه. والجمع الأكف بضمتين.
 قال في المغرب: والسرج الذي على هيئته هو ما يجعل على مقدمة شبه الرمانة،  والوكاف لغة ومنه أو كف الحمار وأكفه ايكافا ووكفه توكيفا أي شد عليه الأكاف،  وأما أكف الأكاف تأكيفا فمعناه اتخذه.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: عن موسى بن بكر الواسطي  ذكره الشيخ في أصحاب أبي السحن الكاظم عليه السلام وقال: أصله كوفي واقفي  له كتاب يروي عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام (1).
 واني لست استثبت وقف الرجل، ولا شيخنا أبو العباس النجاشي تعرض لنقله،  وستطلع على ما رواه أبو عمرو الكشي في مدحه مما ينصرح به أن أسناد الوقف إليه  اختلاق عليه، فاذن الطريق حسن على الأصح.
 قوله رضى الله تعالى عنه: من جزى الله عنه الدنيا  يعني من كان شئ من الدنيا عنده مشكورا محمودا مرغوبا إليه يستحق أن  يقال: جزاه الله عني خيرا فأنا على خلاف سيرته، فإن كان ما في الدنيا مذموم مقبوح
footnote: (1) رجال الشيخ: 359

“The saddle makers that you see, a loaf of barley bread has been on them for days, so what am I to do with these dinars? No, by God, not until God knows that I cannot afford little or much. I have become wealthy through the guardianship of Ali ibn Abi Talib, peace be upon him, and his guided progeny, the rightly guided, the content, the pleasing to Allah, who guide with the truth and judge with it. That is what I heard the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him and his family, say. It is unbecoming for an old man to be a liar.” So he returned them to him, and informed them that he had no need for them or for anything he had, until he meets God, his Lord, and He will be the judge between him and him.
54 - Ali ibn Muhammad al-Qutaibi narrated to me, he said: Al-Fadl ibn Shadhan narrated to me, he said: My father narrated to me, from Ali ibn al-Hakam, from Musa ibn Bakr, who said: Abu al-Hasan, peace be upon him, said: Abu Dharr said: "May God reward the world well for him, but God has rewarded it with blame because of my two loaves of barley bread, one for my lunch and the other for my dinner, and my two woolen cloaks, one I use as a waist wrap and the other I wear.”
---

T Footnote:
---
The *ākāf* (الأكاف): its maker. The plural is *al-ukf* (الأكف) with two dammas.
It is said in *al-Maghrib*: "The saddle that is in its form is what is placed on the front like a pomegranate, and *al-wakāf* (الوكاف) is a language, and from it is *awkaf al-himār* (أوكف الحمار) and *akfahu īkāfan* (أكفه إيكافا) and *wakfahu tawkīfan* (وكفه توكيفا), meaning he tightened the saddle on it, and as for *akf al-ākāf takīfan* (أكف الأكاف تأكيفا), it means he took it.”
His saying, may God have mercy on him: From Musa ibn Bakr al-Wasiti, the Sheikh mentioned him among the companions of Abu al-Hasan al-Kadhim, peace be upon him, and said: "His origin is Kufan, a Waqifi, he has a book that he narrates from Abu Abdullah, peace be upon him (1)."
And I am not certain about the man's *waqf* (وقف) , nor did our Sheikh Abu al-Abbas al-Najashi mention his transmission, and you will see what Abu Amr al-Kashshi narrated in his praise, which clearly indicates that the *isnād* (أسناد) of the *waqf* (وقف) to him is a fabrication against him, so the path is good according to the most correct view.
His saying, may God be pleased with him: "May God reward the world well for him," meaning whoever has something of the world that is gratefully acknowledged, praised, and desired deserves to be said: "May God reward him well for me," but I am contrary to his path, for if what is in the world is blameworthy and ugly.

text:
55 - محمد بن مسعود ومحمد بن الحسن البراثي، قالا حدثنا إبراهيم بن .
____________________
 قال في القاموس: معرب كندو (1).
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: ومحمد بن الحسن البراثي  في طائفة جمة من النسخ بالباء الموحدة قبل الراء والثاء المثلثة بعد الألف.
 قال في القاموس: قرية من نهر الملك، أو محلة عتيقة بالجانب الغربي،  وجامع براثا معروف، وأحمد بن محمد بن خالد وجعفر بن محمد وأبو شعيب  البراثيون محدثون (2).
 وقال شيخنا الشهيد في الذكري: مسجد براثا في غربي بغداد، وهو باق إلى  الان رأيته وصليت فيه (3).
 وفي بعض النسخ البراني بالراء المشددة بعد الباء الموحدة والنون بعد الألف.
 قال الشيخ في باب لم: محمد بن الحسن البراني يكنى أبا بكر كاتب له  رواية (4).
 قلت: وكأنه محمد بن الحسن بن روزبه أبو بكر المدايني الكاتب نزيل الرحبة  الوارد في أسناد الصحيفة الكريمة السجادية.
 وفي القاموس: البرة موضع قتل فيه قابيل هابيل، والبرانية قرية ببخارا منها  سهل بن محمود البراني الفقيه والنجيب محمد بن محمد البراني المحدث (5).
 ولقد حققنا القول فيه في المعلقات على الصحيفة الكريمة (6).

55 - Muhammad bin Mas'ud and Muhammad bin al-Hasan al-Burathi, they said: Ibrahim bin narrated to us.
____________________
He said in al-Qamus: Mu'arrab Kandu (Arabized Kandu) (1).
His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: And Muhammad bin al-Hasan al-Burathi - in a large number of copies, it is with a ba' ( ب ) with a single dot before the ra' ( ر ) and a tha' ( ث ) with three dots after the alif ( ا ).
He said in al-Qamus: A village from Nahr al-Malik, or an old neighborhood on the western side, and the mosque of Buratha is well-known, and Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Khalid and Ja'far bin Muhammad and Abu Shu'aib al-Burathiyun are narrators of hadith (2).
And our Shaykh al-Shahid said in al-Dhikra: The mosque of Buratha is in western Baghdad, and it remains to this day, I saw it and prayed in it (3).
And in some versions, it is al-Burrani with a shaddah on the ra' ( ر ) after the ba' ( ب ) with a single dot and a nun ( ن ) after the alif ( ا ).
The Shaykh said in the chapter on "Lam": Muhammad bin al-Hasan al-Burrani, his kunya is Abu Bakr, a scribe who has narrations (4).
I say: And it seems that he is Muhammad bin al-Hasan bin Ruzbeh Abu Bakr al-Madaini al-Katib, a resident of al-Rahba, mentioned in the isnād (chains of narration) of the noble Sajjadiyya scroll.
And in al-Qamus: Al-Burra is a place where Cain killed Abel, and al-Burraniyya is a village in Bukhara from which comes Sahl bin Mahmud al-Burrani, the jurist, and al-Najib Muhammad bin Muhammad al-Burrani, the muhaddith (narrator of hadith) (5).
And we have indeed verified the saying about it in the annotations on the noble scroll (6).

text:
محمد بن فارس، قال حدثنا محمد بن الحسين بن أبي الخطاب، عن محمد بن سنان عن الحسين بن المختار، عن زيد الشحام، قال سمعت أبا عبد الله عليه السلام يقول طلب .
____________________
 وفي نسخة عتيقة كأنها أصح النسخ " البرناني " بنونين من حاشيتي الألف  وهذا هو الصحيح في هذا الاسناد.
 قال الشيخ في باب لم: محمد بن الحسن البرناني روى عنه الكشي (1).
 وقد أسلفنا تصحيح النسبة فيه، وضبطه بعضهم " البرثاني " بضم الباء الموحدة  والثاء المثلثة بعد الراء نسبة إلى قبيلة برثن.
 قال في الصحاح: وبرثن حي من بني أسد (2).
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: قالا: حدثنا إبراهيم بن محمد بن فارس  هو النيسابوري من أصحاب أبي الحسن الثالث وأبي محمد العسكريين عليهما السلام  ذكره الشيخ في أصحابهما (3).
 قال في الخلاصة: لا بأس به في نفسه ولكن بعض من يروي هو عنه (4).
 قلت: وهذه بعينها عبارة محمد بن مسعود العياشي على ما روى عنه الكشي (5)  وسيجئ في الكتاب، فقول بعض شهداء المتأخرين (6) في حاشيته على الخلاصة  في كتاب الكشي ثقة في نفسه نقل لا أصل له.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: عن الحسين بن المختار  هو القلانسي وقد أوضحنا لك فيما سبق استقامته وثقته.

text:
أبو ذر رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله فقيل له انه في حائط كذا وكذا، فتوجه في طلبه فوجده نائما فأعظمه أن ينبهه، فأراد ان يستبري نومه من يقظته فأخذ عسيبا يابسا فكسره ليسمعه صوته فسمعه رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله فرفع رأسه، فقال: يا أبا ذر تخدعني أما علمت أني أرى أعمالكم في منامي كما أراكم في يقظتي ان عيني تنامان ولا ينام قلبي.
____________________
 قوله عليه السلام: فأخذ عسيبا يابسا.
 باهمال العين المفتوحة وكسر السين المهملة وتسكين المثناة من تحت قبل  الياء الموحدة، أي جريدة من النخل مستقيمة دقيقة.
 قوله صلى الله عليه وآله: ان عيني تنامان ولا ينام قلبي  قال السيد المكرم الرضي أخو السيد المعظم المرتضى رضي الله تعالى عنهما  في كتاب مجازات الحديث: ومن ذلك قوله عليه الصلاة والسلام تنام عيناي ولا ينام  قلبي. وهذا القول عند المحققين من العلماء مجاز، لأنه عليه السلام لو كان قلبه لا ينام على  الحقيقة كقلوب الناس لكان ذلك من أكبر معجزاته وأبهر آياته، ولوجب أن تتظاهر  الاخبار بنقله، كما تظاهرت بنقل غيره من أعلامه ودلالته.
 ومما يحقق قولنا ما رواه عبد الله بن عباس رحمهما الله من أنه صلى الله عليه وآله نام ونفخ  فصلى ولم يتوض، فقيل له عليه الصلاة والسلام في ذلك فقال: ليس الوضوء على  من نام قاعدا انما الوضوء على من نام مضطجعا، وفى بعض الروايات أو متوركا فإنه  إذا نام كذلك استرخت مفاصله.
 فبين عليه الصلاة والسلام أنه لو نام مضطجعا للزمه الوضوء لاسترخاء مفاصله،  فلو كان قلبه لا ينام لما وجب عليه الوضوء إذا نام مضطجعا، كما لا يجب عليه إذا نام  قاعدا، وقد يجوز أن يكون المراد بقوله عليه السلام: تنام عيناي ولا ينام قلبي. أنه لا يعتقد  في حال نومه من الرؤيا الفاسدة والمنامات المتضادة ما يعتقده غيره من سائر البشر،  فيكون في حكم المستيقظ وبمنزلة المتحفظ (1) انتهى كلامه رفع مقامه.

translation:
T Text:
---
Abu Dharr, may Allah bless him and his family, (was looking for) the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family. He was told that he was in such-and-such garden. So, he went in search of him and found him sleeping. He (Abu Dharr) considered it too great to wake him. He wanted to ascertain his state of sleep from wakefulness, so he took a dry palm branch and broke it to let him hear its sound. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, heard him and raised his head and said: "O Abu Dharr, are you trying to deceive me? Did you not know that I see your deeds in my sleep as I see you in my wakefulness? Verily, my eyes sleep, but my heart does not sleep."

His saying, peace be upon him: "So he took a dry palm branch."
With the neglect of the open 'ayn and the breaking of the unpointed sīn and the sukoon of the dual tāʾ from below before the single yāʾ, meaning a straight, thin palm frond.

His saying, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him: "Verily, my eyes sleep, but my heart does not sleep." Al-Sayyid al-Mukarram al-Radhi, the brother of al-Sayyid al-Mu'azzam al-Murtada, may Allah Almighty be pleased with them both, said in the book *Majāzāt al-Ḥadīth*: "And among that is his saying, peace and blessings be upon him: 'My eyes sleep, but my heart does not sleep.' And this saying, according to the *muḥaqqiqīn* (verifiers) among the scholars, is a metaphor, because if his heart did not sleep in reality like the hearts of people, that would be one of his greatest miracles and most dazzling signs, and it would have been necessary for the reports to be widely circulated in its transmission, as they were widely circulated in the transmission of other of his signs and indications.

And what verifies our saying is what Abdullah ibn Abbas, may Allah have mercy on them both, narrated that he, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, slept and snored, then prayed without performing ablution. So, he, peace and blessings be upon him, was asked about that, and he said: 'Ablution is not required for one who sleeps sitting, but ablution is only required for one who sleeps lying down.' And in some narrations, 'or sitting on his hips,' for if he sleeps like that, his joints relax."

So, he, peace and blessings be upon him, clarified that if he slept lying down, ablution would be required of him due to the relaxation of his joints. So, if his heart did not sleep, ablution would not be required of him if he slept lying down, just as it is not required of him if he sleeps sitting. And it is permissible that what is meant by his saying, peace be upon him: "My eyes sleep, but my heart does not sleep," is that he does not believe in the state of his sleep in false visions and contradictory dreams what others of the rest of mankind believe, so he is in the ruling of the awake and in the position of the guarded. End of his speech, may his status be elevated.

عمار 56 - حدثني علي بن محمد بن قتيبة النيسابوري، قال حدثنا الفضل بن شاذان عن محمد بن سنان، عن أبي خالد، عن حمران بن أعين، عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام، قال قلت: ما تقول في عمار؟ قال: رحم الله عمارا، ثلاثا قاتل مع أمير المؤمنين (صلوات الله عليه وآله) وقتل شهيدا. قال: قلت في نفسي ما تكون منزلة أعظم من هذه المنزلة؟ فالتفت إلي، فقال لعلك تقول مثل الثلاثة! هيهات! قال، قلت: وما علمه انه يقتل في ذلك اليوم؟ قال: إنه لما رأي الحرب لا تزداد الا شدة والقتل لا يزداد الا كثرة ترك الصف وجاء إلى أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام فقال يا أمير المؤمنين هو هو؟ قال:
ارجع إلى صفك، فقال له ذلك ثلاث مرات، كل ذلك يقول له ارجع إلى صفك، فلما أن كان في الثالثة قال له نعم. فرجع إلى صفه وهو يقول: اليوم ألقى الا حبة محمدا وحزبه.
____________________
 في عمار بن ياسر رضي الله عنه  هو أبو اليقظان سماه النبي صلى الله عليه وآله بالطيب المطيب شهد بدرا، ولم يشهدها ابن  من المؤمنين غيره، وشهدا أحدا والمشاهد كلها مع النبي صلى الله عليه وآله والجمل وصفين مع  أمير المؤمنين، وقتل بصفين شهيدا ودفن هناك سنة سبع وثلاثين وهو ابن ثلاث  وتسعين سنة.
 قوله رحمه الله: عن أبي خالد  يعني به الكابلي وقد فصلنا القول فيه سابقا.
 قوله عليه السلام: فقال يا أمير المؤمنين هو هو؟ يعني يومنا هذا هو يومي الذي خبرني رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله أنه تقتلني فيه الفئة  الباغية.

'Ammar 56 - Ali ibn Muhammad ibn Qutayba al-Naysaburi narrated to me, saying: Al-Fadl ibn Shadhan narrated to us from Muhammad ibn Sinan, from Abi Khalid, from Humran ibn A'yan, from Abi Ja'far, peace be upon him, who said: I said, "What do you say about 'Ammar?" He said: "May Allah have mercy on 'Ammar," three times. "He fought with the Commander of the Believers (may Allah's blessings and peace be upon him and his family) and was killed as a martyr." He said: I said to myself, "What station could be greater than this station?" He turned to me and said, "Perhaps you are saying like the three!" Impossible! He said, I said: “How did he know that he would be killed on that day?” He said: “When he saw that the war was only increasing in intensity and the killing was only increasing in number, he left the line and came to the Commander of the Believers, peace be upon him, and said, “O Commander of the Believers, is it it?” He said:
Return to your line." He said this to him three times, each time he said to him, "Return to your line." When it was the third time, he said to him, "Yes." So he returned to his line, saying: "Today I meet my beloved Muhammad and his party."

Regarding 'Ammar ibn Yasir, may Allah be pleased with him: He is Abu al-Yaqzan, whom the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, named al-Tayyib al-Mutayyab (the good, the purified). He witnessed Badr, and no one else from the believers witnessed it with him. He witnessed Uhud and all the battles with the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and al-Jamal and Siffin with the Commander of the Believers, and was killed as a martyr in Siffin and buried there in the year thirty-seven, when he was ninety-three years old.

His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: From Abi Khalid means al-Kabuli, and we have discussed him in detail previously.

His saying, peace be upon him: He said, “O Commander of the Believers, is it it?” Meaning, “Is this day my day that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, told me that the rebellious group will kill me on it?”

 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: محمد بن أحمد بن أبي عوف البخاري ومحمد  ابن سعد (1) بن مزيد الكشي  قد مر ذكرهما وتحقيق القول فيهما في صدر الكتاب.
 قوله: فلم تصله النار  بفتح التاء المضارعة وتسكين الصاد المهملة، أي لم تشوه ولم تحرقه، يقال:
 صلى اللحم يصليه صليا شواه وألقاه في النار للاحراق، والصلا بالفتح والقصر،  والصلاء بالكسر والمد النار أو الوقود أو الشواء، ولم يصله بفتح الياء وكسر الصاد  من الوصول.
 وفي طائفة من النسخ " فلم يصبه " منها مكروه بالباء الموحدة بعد الصاد من  الإصابة.

57 - Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Abi Awf al-Bukhari and Muhammad ibn Sa'd ibn Mazid al-Kashshi said: Abu Ali al-Mahmudi Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Hammad al-Marwazi narrated to us, [regarding] Ammar ibn Yasir, about whom the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him and his family, said after the Quraysh threw him into the fire: "O fire, be coolness and safety upon Ammar as you were coolness and safety upon Abraham." The fire did not harm him, and no harm touched him. The Quraysh killed his parents, and the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him and his family, said: "Patience, O family of Yasir, your meeting place is Paradise. What do you want from Ammar? Ammar is with the truth, and the truth is with Ammar wherever he is. Ammar…"
His saying, may God have mercy on him: Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Abi Awf al-Bukhari and Muhammad ibn Sa'd ibn Mazid al-Kashshi, their mention and the verification of the statement about them have already passed in the introduction of the book.
His saying: "The fire did not harm him" – with the opening of the ta' (ت) of the present tense verb and the quiescence of the ṣād (ص), meaning it did not disfigure or burn him. It is said: ṣalā al-laḥm yaṣlīhi ṣalyan (صلى اللحم يصليه صليا) – he grilled the meat and threw it into the fire to burn it. Al-ṣalā (الصلا) with a fatha (فتحة) and short vowel, and al-ṣalā' (الصلاء) with a kasra (كسرة) and long vowel, means the fire, the fuel, or the grilling. "Wa lam yaṣilhu (ولم يصله)" with the opening of the yā’ (ي) and the kasra (كسرة) of the ṣād (ص) from reaching.
And in a group of copies: "falam yuṣibhu (فلم يصبه)" harm touched him with the bā’ (ب) after the ṣād (ص) from being afflicted.
His saying, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him and his family: "Ammar is with the truth, and the truth is with Ammar wherever he is" - this hadith from him, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him and his family, is authentic and of proven soundness according to both the common people and the elite through more than one route, as well as "Follow the guidance of Ammar (wa-ihdū hudyya 'Ammār) (واهدوا هدي عمار)" is agreed upon by all, narrated with the opening of the hā’ (ه) and the kasra (كسرة) and quiescence of the dāl (د).
Ibn al-Athir said in al-Nihaya: Al-hudā (الهدى) is the conduct, appearance, and way. And from it is the hadith: "Follow the guidance of Ammar." That is, follow his conduct and resemble his appearance. It is said: hadā hudyya fulān (هدى هدي فلان) if

 صار بسيرته (1).
 ورووا: إذا سلك الناس واديا وعمار واديا فاسلكوا مسلك عمار.
 قلت: وذلك كله اخبار منه صلى الله عليه وآله بأن فيما يقع بعده من الأثرة يكون العمار مع  علي عليه السلام متبعا له متبرءا عمن يستأثر عليه صلوات الله عليه بحقه، كالمقداد وأبو ذر  وسلمان وغيرهم من السابقين، كما قد سبق في الكتاب.
 قال المسعودي في مروج الذهب: وقد كان عمار حين بويع عثمان بلغه قول  أبي سفيان صخر بن حرب في دار عثمان في الوقت الذي بويع فيه عثمان، ودخل  داره ومعه بنو أمية، قال أبو سفيان: أفيكم أحد من غير كم؟ وقد كان أعمى قالوا:
 لا قال: يا بني انكم تلقفتموها تلقف الكرة، فوالذي يحلف به أبو سفيان لتصيرن إلى  صبيانكم وراثة، فانتهره عثمان وساءه ما قال، ونمى هذا القول إلى المهاجرين  والأنصار وغير ذلك:
 فقام عمار في المسجد وقال: يا معشر قريش أما إذ صرفتم هذا الامر من أهل  بيت نبيكم هاهنا مرة وهاهنا مرة، فما أنا بآمن أن ينزعه الله منكم فيضعه في غيركم،  كما نزعتموه من أهله ووضعتموه في غير أهله.
 وقام المقداد فقال: ما رأيت مثل الذي أو ذي به أهل هذا البيت بعد نبيهم،  فقال له عبد الرحمن بن عوف: وما أنت وذلك يا مقداد بن عمرو فقال: اني والله  لا حبهم بحب رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله إياهم، وأن الحق معهم وفيهم يا عبد الرحمن، أعجب  من قريش، وانما تطولهم على الناس بفضل أهل هذا البيت، قد أصفقوا على نزع  سلطان رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله بعده من أيديهم، أما وأيم الله يا عبد الرحمن لو أجد على قريش  أنصارا لقاتلتهم كقتالي إياهم مع رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله يوم بدر (2).

And they narrated: "If people go through a valley and 'Ammār goes through another valley, then follow the path of 'Ammār."
I say: All of that is information from him, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, that in what occurs after him of self-preference, al-'Ammār will be with 'Ali, peace be upon him, following him and disavowing those who give preference to others over him, may God’s blessings be upon him, regarding his right, like al-Miqdād, Abu Dharr, Salmān, and others from the early Muslims, as has already been mentioned in the book.
Al-Mas'udi said in Murūj al-Dhahab: "When 'Ammār was given allegiance to 'Uthmān, the saying of Abu Sufyān Sakhr ibn Harb reached him in the house of 'Uthmān at the time when allegiance was given to 'Uthmān. He entered his house with the Banu Umayya, and Abu Sufyān said: 'Is there anyone among you who is not of your kin?' He was blind. They said: 'No.' He said: 'O my sons, you have seized it as one seizes a ball. By the one by whom Abu Sufyān swears, it will surely become an inheritance for your boys.' 'Uthmān rebuked him and was displeased with what he said. This saying reached the Muhājirūn (Emigrants) and the Anṣār (Helpers) and others."
'Ammār stood up in the mosque and said: "O gathering of Quraysh, now that you have diverted this matter from the People of the House of your Prophet here once and there once, I am not safe from God taking it away from you and placing it in others, just as you took it away from its people and placed it in other than its people."
Al-Miqdād stood up and said: "I have not seen the like of what the People of this House have been subjected to after their Prophet." 'Abd al-Rahmān ibn 'Awf said to him: "What is that to you, O Miqdād ibn 'Amr?" He said: "By God, I love them with the love of the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, for them, and the truth is with them and within them, O 'Abd al-Rahmān. How strange of Quraysh! They only claim superiority over people because of the virtue of the People of this House. They have unanimously agreed to remove the authority of the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, from their hands after him. By God, O 'Abd al-Rahmān, if I found helpers against Quraysh, I would fight them as I fought them with the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, on the day of Badr (2)."

جلدة بين عيني وانفي تقتله الفئة الباغية، وقال وقت قتلهم إياه: اليوم ألقى الأحبة محمدا وحزبه، يدعوهم إلى الجنة ويدعونه إلى النار.
58 - حمدويه وإبراهيم قالا حدثنا أيوب بن نوح، عن صفوان، عن عاصم ابن حميد، عن فضيل الرسان، قال سمعت أبا داود، وهو يقول حدثني بريدة الأسلمي ____________________
 قوله صلى الله عليه وآله وسلم: عمار جلدة بين عيني وأنفى  وفي بعض النسخ جلدة ما بين عيني وأنفي، وهذا أشهر في الرواية في أصول  العامة والخاصة، وذلك كناية عن شدة الاتصال والاختصاص. الجلد: قشر البدن،  وجمعه الجلود.
 قال في الصحاح: الجلد واحد الجلود، والجلدة أخص منه (1).
 ومتن الحديث منتظما: تقتله الفئة الباغية يدعوهم إلى الجنة ويدعونه إلى  النار.
 وأما " قال وقت قتلهم إياه اليوم ألقى الأحبة محمدا وحزبه " فكلام الراوي  نقلا لقول عمار وقع في البين اقحاما.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: عن عاصم بن حميد عن فضيل الرسان  الطريق حسن بالفضيل الرسان، وعالي الاسناد في الطبقة الأولى، وأبو داود  من أصحاب رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله ذكره الشيخ رحمه الله في كتاب الرجال (2).
 وسيرد في الكتاب حديثه عن عمران بن حصين: أن رسول ل الله صلى الله عليه وآله أمر  فلانا وفلانا - يعني أبا بكر وعمر أن يسلما على علي عليه السلام بأمره المؤمنين الحديث.
 وبريدة الأسلمي أخوه لامه وهو أيضا من أصحاب رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله من السابقين  الذين رجعوا إلى أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام قاله العلامة في الخلاصة (3) وسيرد في الكتاب

'Ammar is like the skin between my eyes and nose; the rebellious group will kill him." And he said when they killed him: "Today I meet my beloved ones, Muhammad and his companions, inviting them to Paradise while they invite me to Hell."
58 - Hamdawayh and Ibrahim said: Ayyub bin Nuh narrated to us, from Safwan, from Asim bin Hamid, from Fudayl al-Rassan, who said: I heard Abu Dawud say: Buraydah al-Aslami narrated to me...
____________________
His saying, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him: "Ammar is like the skin between my eyes and nose." In some versions: "the skin between my eyes and my nose," and this is more well-known in narration in both Sunni and Shi'a sources. This is a metaphor for the intensity of connection and exclusivity. "Al-Jild" (the skin) is the covering of the body, and its plural is "al-julud" (the skins).
It is said in al-Sihah: "Al-jild" (the skin) is the singular of "al-julud" (the skins), and "al-jilda" (the piece of skin) is more specific than it (1).
The text of the hadith in its entirety is: "The rebellious group will kill him, inviting them to Paradise while they invite him to Hell."
As for "He said when they killed him, 'Today I meet my beloved ones, Muhammad and his companions'", it is the narrator's words, conveying 'Ammar's statement, inserted in between as an intrusion.
His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: from 'Asim bin Hamid, from Fudayl al-Rassan: The route (isnād) is good through Fudayl al-Rassan, and it is a high isnād (chain of narration) in the first layer, and Abu Dawud is one of the companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, mentioned by Sheikh (al-Tusi), may Allah have mercy on him, in the book of Rijal (2).
And there will come in the book his hadith from Imran bin Husayn: That the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, ordered so-and-so and so-and-so - meaning Abu Bakr and Umar - to greet Ali, peace be upon him, with "Commander of the Believers" (Amir al-Mu'minin), the hadith.
And Buraydah al-Aslami is his brother from his mother's side, and he is also one of the companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, from the first to return to Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, as stated by al-'Allama in al-Khulasa (3) and it will come in the book

قال سمعت رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله يقول: إن الجنة تشتاق إلى ثلاثة قال فجاء أبو بكر، فقيل له: يا أبا بكر أنت الصديق وأنت ثاني اثنين إذ هما في الغار، فلو سألت رسول ____________________
 من ذي قبل انشاء الله العزيز.
 وذكر الشيخ في أصحاب أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام بريدة الخصيب الأسلمي الخزاعي  وقال: مدني عربي (1).
 وقيل: بريدة أبو الخصيب.
 الصواب فيه ضم الحاء وفتح الصاد المهملتين على التصغير كزبير كما في  جامع الأصول والقاموس (2) والمغرب، وضبطه المصحفون باعجام الخاء المفتوحة  واهمال الصاد المكسورة بعدها ويقال باعجام الضاد.
 قوله: أنت الصديق  بكسر الصاد والدال المشددة المهملتين على فعيل بناء للمبالغة في التصديق.
 ونحن نقول: يستبين من فزعه وحزنه في الغار، وهو مع النبي الكريم الموعود  من السماء بالنصر والتأييد والامن والغلبة، وقوله " ان تصب اليوم ذهب دين الله " أنه  كان ضعيف اليقين جدا في الوثوق بالله والتصديق لرسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله، فهو بذلك  خارج عن استحقاق اسم التصديق.
 قوله: وأنت ثاني اثنين إذ هما في الغار  بسكون الياء ارتفاعا على الخير، أي أنت أحد اثنين إذ هما في الغار، وأما في  التنزيل الكريم فثاني اثنين عبارة عن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله قال الله تعالى " الا تنصروه فقد  نصره الله إذ أخرجه الذين كفروا ثاني اثنين إذ هما في الغار إذ يقول لصاحبه لا تحزن  ان الله معنا فأنزل الله سكينة عليه وأيده بجنود لم تروها (3) " الضمائر كلها لرسول

He said: I heard the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, say: "Paradise yearns for three." He said: Abu Bakr came, and it was said to him: "O Abu Bakr, you are al-Ṣiddīq (the truthful), and you are the second of two when they were in the cave, so if you had asked the Messenger ____________________
 from before, God Almighty willing.
And the Sheikh mentioned in the companions of Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, Buraydah al-Khasib al-Aslami al-Khuza'i, and he said: "Madani, Arab (1)."
And it was said: Buraydah Abu al-Khasib.
The correct thing in it is to include the ḥāʾ and open the Ṣād al-muhmalatayn on the diminutive like Zubayr as in Jami' al-Usul, al-Qamus (2), and al-Maghrib, and the miswriters adjusted it by including the open khāʾ and neglecting the broken Ṣād after it, and it is said by including the Ḍād.
His saying: "You are al-Ṣiddīq (the truthful)" with a kasrah on the ṣād and a shaddah on the dāl al-muhmalatayn on the pattern of fa'īl, a form of exaggeration in believing.
And we say: it becomes clear from his panic and grief in the cave, while he is with the Noble Prophet, promised from heaven with victory, support, security, and triumph, and his saying, "If you are harmed today, the religion of God is gone," that he was very weak in certainty in trusting God and believing in the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, so he is therefore excluded from deserving the name of al-Tasdīq (affirmation as truth).
His saying: "And you are the second of two when they were in the cave" with a sukun on the yāʾ in the nominative case as the predicate, meaning you are one of two when they were in the cave, but in the Noble Revelation, "the second of two" is an expression for the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him, God Almighty said, "If you do not support him, God has already supported him when those who disbelieved drove him out [as] one of two, when they were in the cave, when he said to his companion, "Do not grieve; indeed God is with us." And God sent down his tranquility upon him and supported him with soldiers you did not see (3)." All the pronouns refer to the Messenger

 الله صلى الله عليه وآله باتفاق المفسرين.
 قال في الكشاف: وأسند الاخراج إلى الكفار كما أسند إليهم في قوله " من  قريتك التي أخرجتك " لانهم حين هموا باخراجه أذن الله له في الخروج فكأنهم  أخرجوه " ثاني اثنين " أحد اثنين، كقوله ثالث ثلاثة، وهما رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله وأبو بكر  وانتصابه على الحال وقرئ ثاني اثنين بالسكون و" إذ هما " بدل من إذ أخرجه، والغار  نقب في أعلى ثور، وهو جبل في يمين مكة على مسيرة ساعة مكثا فيه ثلاثا.
 " إذ يقول " بدل ثان قيل: طلع المشركون فوق الغار فاشفق أبو بكر على رسول  الله صلى الله عليه وآله فقال: ان تصب اليوم ذهب دين الله، فقال صلى الله عليه وآله: ما ظنك باثنين الله ثالثهما  وقيل: لما دخل الغار بعث الله حمامتين فباضتا في أسفله والعنكبوت فنسجت عليه  فقال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله: اللهم أعم أبصار هم: فجعلوا يترددون حول الغار ولا يفطنون  قد أخذ الله أبصارهم عنه " سكينه " ما ألقي في قلبه من الامنة التي سكن عندها وعلم  أنهم لا يصلون إليه، والجنود الملائكة يوم بدر والأحزاب وحنين (1).
 قلت: سياق (2) الآية الكريمة بلسان بلاغتها تنطق بوجوه من الطعن في جلالة  أبي بكر:
 الأول: أن همه وحزنه وفزعه وانزعاجه وقلقه حين إذ هو مع النبي الكريم  المأمور من تلقاء ربه الحفيظ الرقيب بالخروج والهجرة، والموعود من السماء على  لسان روح القدس الأمين بالتأييد والنصرة، مما يكشف عن ضعف يقينه وركاكة  ايمانه جدا.
 الثاني أن انزال الله سكينته عليه صلى الله عليه وآله فقط لا على أبي بكر ولا عليهما جمعيا،  مع كون أبي بكر أحوج إلى السكينة حينئذ لقلقه وحزنه على أنه لم يكن

Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, according to the consensus of interpreters.
He said in al-Kashshaf: And the expulsion is attributed to the disbelievers as it is attributed to them in His saying, "from your city which drove you out," because when they intended to expel him, Allah permitted him to leave, so it was as if they expelled him. "The second of two" one of two, like His saying "the third of three," and they are the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and Abu Bakr, and its accusative is circumstantial. It is also recited as "thani ithnayn" with sukun (absence of vowel). "When they were" is a substitute for "when he drove him out," and the cave is a hole at the top of Thor, which is a mountain to the right of Mecca, an hour's journey away, where they stayed for three [nights].
"When he says" is a second substitute. It was said that the polytheists climbed above the cave, and Abu Bakr became anxious for the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and said: If you are afflicted today, the religion of Allah will be gone. So he, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: What do you think of two, Allah is the third of them? It was said that when he entered the cave, Allah sent two doves that laid eggs in its bottom, and a spider that spun [a web] over it. So the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said: O Allah, blind their eyes. So they kept going around the cave without noticing, Allah had taken their sight away from him. "His tranquility" is what was cast into his heart of security, at which he became calm and knew that they would not reach him, and the soldiers were the angels on the Day of Badr, al-Ahzab (the Confederates), and Hunayn (1).
I say: The context (2) of the noble verse, in the eloquence of its language, expresses aspects of disparagement of Abu Bakr's greatness:
First: His concern, grief, fright, agitation, and anxiety when he was with the noble Prophet, who was commanded from his watchful, observant Lord to leave and emigrate, and promised from heaven by the tongue of the trusted Holy Spirit with support and victory, reveals a great weakness in his certainty and fragility of his faith.

 أهلا لذلك.
 وتحامل احتمال أن يرجع الضمير في عليه على أبي بكر كما تجشمه البيضاوي  مع أن فيه خرق اتفاق المفسرين وشق عصاهم خلاف ما تتعاطاه قوانين العلوم اللسانية  والفنون الأدبية، أليس ضمير " أيده " و" عليه " في الجملتين المطوفة والمعطوفة عليها  يعودان إلى مفاد واحد، وضمير " وأيده " بجنود لم تروها " في الجملة المعطوفة للنبي  صلى الله عليه وآله بلا امتراء، فكذلك ضمير عليه في الجملة المعطوف عليها، أعني " فأنزل الله  سكينته عليه ".
 الثالث: أن أسلوب " إذ يقول لصاحبه لا تحزن " في العبارة عن أبي بكر يضاهي  أسلوب " يا صاحبي السجن (1) " في سورة يوسف " فقال لصاحبه وهو يحاوره (2) " في  سورة الكهف، فلا تكونن عن ديدن القرآن الحكيم وهجيراه في رموزه وأسراره  من الغافلين.
 ثم انى أقول: يا سبحان الله ما أبعد البون وأبين البعد درجة أبي بكر في  اليقين والثقة بالله ورسوله حين كان مع النبي في الغار، وبين درجة مولانا علي بن  أبي طالب عليه السلام ليلة المبيت على فراش رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله وحده، فاديا إياه بنفسه،  باذلا مهجته في سبيل ربه ويقينه وثقته بالله، كجبل رأس لا تزلزله الرياح العواصف  ولا تزعجه الرماح القواصف، وقد نزل فيه التنزيل الكريم " ومن الناس من يشري  نفسه ابتغاء مرضات الله والله رؤوف بالعباد (3) ".
 قال علامة علماء العامة وامام المتشككين منهم فخر الدين الرازي في التفسير  الكبير: في سبب النزول روايات:

Welcome to that.
And to strain the possibility that the pronoun in "عليه" (upon him) refers to Abu Bakr, as Al-Baydawi took upon himself, despite it violating the consensus of the commentators and breaking their ranks, is contrary to what the laws of linguistic sciences and literary arts dictate. Do not the pronouns "أيده" (strengthened him) and "عليه" (upon him) in the two sentences, the encircled and that which is encircled by it, refer to one meaning? And the pronoun "وأيده بجنود لم تروها" (and strengthened him with hosts you did not see) in the sentence that is encircled by it refers to the Prophet, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, without a doubt. Likewise, the pronoun "عليه" (upon him) in the sentence that is encircled by it, meaning "فأنزل الله سكينته عليه" (so Allah sent down His tranquility upon him).

Third: That the style "إذ يقول لصاحبه لا تحزن" (when he said to his companion, "Do not grieve") in the expression about Abu Bakr is similar to the style "يا صاحبي السجن" (O my two companions of the prison) in Surah Yusuf and "فقال لصاحبه وهو يحاوره" (and said to his companion while he was conversing with him) in Surah Al-Kahf. So, do not be among the heedless of the way of the Wise Quran and its custom in its symbols and secrets.

Then I say: Glory be to God! How vast is the difference and how clear the distance between the degree of Abu Bakr in certainty and trust in God and His Messenger when he was with the Prophet in the cave, and the degree of our master Ali ibn Abi Talib, peace be upon him, on the night of the bed-sacrifice on the bed of the Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, alone, redeeming him with himself, sacrificing his life in the path of his Lord, his certainty, and his trust in God, like a firm mountain that is not shaken by the raging winds nor disturbed by the piercing spears. And the Noble Revelation was revealed concerning him: "And of the people is he who sells his soul seeking means to the approval of Allah . And Allah is ever kind to the servants (2:207)."

The sign of the scholars of the commoners and the Imam of the skeptics among them, Fakhr al-Din al-Razi, said in *al-Tafsir al-Kabir*: "There are narrations regarding the reason for the revelation":

 قضي لي رسول الله فلم يرض بقضائه وخاصم إليك فقال عمر للمنافق: أكذلك؟
 قال: نعم، فقال: مكانكما حتى أخرج اليكما، فدخل عمر فأخذ بسيفه ثم خرج فضرب  به عنق المنافق حتى برد وقال، هكذا أقضي لمن لم يرض بقضاء الله ورسوله فنزلت  وقال جبرئيل عليه السلام: ان عمر فرق بين الحق والباطل فسمي الفاروق.
 والطاغوت على هذا كعب بن الأشرف، وفي معناه من يحكم بالباطل ويؤثر  لأجله سمي بذلك لفرط طغيانه أو لتشبيه بالشيطان، أو لا ن التحكم إليه تحاكم إلى  الشيطان من حيث أنه الحامل عليه كما قال " وقد امروا أن يكفروا وبه ويريد الشيطان  أن يضلهم ضلالا بعيدا " وقرئ أن يكفروا بها على أن الطاغوت جمع لقوله " أولياءهم  الطاغوت يخرجونهم ".
 " وإذ قيل لهم تعالوا إلى ما أنزل الله والى الرسول " وقرئ تعالوا بضم اللام على  أنه حذف لام الفعل اعتباطا، ثم ضم اللام لواو الضمير " رأيت المنافقين يصدون  عنك صدودا " وهو مصدر أو اسم للمصدر الذي هو الصد، والفرق بينه وبين السد أنه  غير محسوس والسد محسوس، ويصدون في موضع الحال.
 فكيف يكون حالهم " إذا أصابتهم مصيبة " كقتل عمر المنافق أو النقمة من الله  " بما قدمت أيديهم " من التحاكم إلى غيرك وعدم الرضا بحكمك " ثم جاؤوك " حين  يصابون للاعتذار، عطف على أصابتهم وقيل: على يصدون وما بينهما اعتراض،  " يحلفون بالله " حال " ان أردنا الا احسانا وتوفيقا " ما أردنا الا الفصل بالوجه الأحسن  والتوفيق بين الخمصين ولم نرد مخالفتك، وقيل: جاء أصحاب القتيل طالبين بدمه  وقالوا: ما أردنا بالتحكم إلى عمر الا أن يحسن إلى صاحبنا ويوفق بينه خمصه  انتهي (1).
 قلت: يا قوم أليس ما قدمت أيديهم الذي جاءوا أصحاب القتيل للاعتذار عنه
footnote: (1) نقل القصة بتمامه الزمخشري في الكشاف مع تفاوت يسير: 1 / 536
translation:
T Text:
---
The Messenger of Allah judged for me, but he (the منافق - hypocrite) was not satisfied with his judgment and argued with you. So, 'Umar said to the منافق (hypocrite): "Is that so?" He said: "Yes." So, he said: "Stay where you are until I come out to you." Then 'Umar entered and took his sword, then came out and struck the neck of the منافق (hypocrite) with it until he was cold (dead), and said: "This is how I judge for those who are not satisfied with the judgment of Allah and His Messenger." Then it was revealed, and Gabriel (peace be upon him) said: "Indeed, 'Umar has distinguished between truth and falsehood," and so he was named Al-Farooq (The distinguisher).
And at-Ṭāghūt, according to this, is Ka'b ibn al-Ashraf, and in its meaning is whoever judges with falsehood and favors it. He is called that because of his excessive transgression or to resemble the devil, or because appealing to him is appealing to the devil, since he is the one who carries it, as He said: "And they were commanded to disbelieve in it, and Satan wants to lead them far astray." And it was recited "أن يكفروا بها" (that they disbelieve in it) on the basis that at-Ṭāghūt is the plural of His saying: "Their allies - Ṭāghūt - drive them out."
"And when it is said to them, "Come to what Allah has revealed and to the Messenger," and it was recited "تعالوا" (come) with a ḍamma on the lām, on the basis that the lām of the verb was omitted arbitrarily, then the ḍamma was added to the lām for the wāw of the pronoun "you see the منافقين (hypocrites) turning away from you in aversion." And it is a مصدر (verbal noun) or a noun for the مصدر (verbal noun), which is aversion, and the difference between it and blocking is that it is not perceptible, while blocking is perceptible, and "turning away" is in the place of the ḥāl (circumstantial qualifier).
So how will their condition be "when a disaster strikes them" like 'Umar killing the منافق (hypocrite) or revenge from Allah "because of what their hands have put forth" from appealing to other than you and not being satisfied with your judgment "then they come to you" when they are afflicted to apologize. It is connected to "afflicts them" and it was said: connected to "they turn away" and what is between them is an interpolation "Swearing by Allah" ḥāl (circumstantial qualifier) "We intended nothing but good and reconciliation" We intended nothing but separation in the best way and reconciliation between the disputants and we did not intend to oppose you, and it was said: The relatives of the slain came seeking his blood and said: We did not intend by appealing to 'Umar except that he be kind to our companion and reconcile between his opponents, end. (1)
I say: O people, is it not what their hands have put forth that the relatives of the slain came to apologize for?

 وهو التحاكم إلى عمر باعترافكم هو التحاكم إلى الطاغوت الذي عليه المعاتبة في  الآية الكريمة، وعنه اعتذروا أصحاب القتيل الطالبون بدمه بأنه انما أرادوا بذلك  الاصلاح والتوفيق بين الخصمين، لا القضاء والحكم لمن له الحق على خصمه،  والعدول عن رسول الله بالتحاكم إليه حتى يستحق القتل ويكون دمه هدرا.
 فكيف يستقيم قولكم؟ والطاغوت على هذا كعب بن الأشرف بل المستبين  على هذا أن يكون الطاغوت ها هنا هو عمر أو عمرو كعب بن الأشرف جميعا.
 وبالجملة كل من يراد أن يتحاكم إليه لا إلى رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله فليس يصح لكم  في التوجيه الا أن تقولوا سمي عمر بذلك (كما سمى به كعب بن الأشرف على  المجاز المرسل) لان التحاكم إليه كان تحاكما إلى الطاغوت، أي الشيطان، لان  الشيطان كان الحامل عليه، أو لما كان فيه من الفظاظة والغلظة فسمي ذلك " طغيانا "  والفظ الغليظ " طاغوتا " وإذا كان الطاغوت جمعا كما قلتم وهو الصواب لقوله  سبحانه " أوليائهم الطاغوت " فلا يصح حمله على كعب بن الأشرف فقط.
 فاذن ما أسندتموه إلى جبرئيل عليه السلام من القول وجعلتموه سببا لتسميتكم عمر  ب‍ " الفاروق " غير مناسب لمشرع المقام ومنهل البلاغة.
 ثم أقول: قد روى مفسر وكم ومحدثو كم أن قوله سبحانه وتعالى " يا أيها الذين  آمنوا ادخلوا في السلم كافة ولا تتبعوا خطوات الشيطان انه لكم عدو مبين فان زللتم  من بعد ما جاءتكم البينات فاعلموا أن الله عزيز حكيم (1) " نزل في عمر فحديث التهوك  في ذلك مستفيض مشهور متلون المتن متشعب الطريق في أصولكم الصحاح وشرحه  شراح الحديث من علمائكم.
 قال صاحب الكشاف في الفائق: النبي صلى الله عليه وآله قال له عمر: انا نسمع أحاديث  من يهود تعجبنا أفترى أن نكتب بعضها فقال: أمتهو كون أنتم؟ كما تهوكت اليهود
footnote: (١) سورة البقرة: ٢٠٨ - 209
translation:
T Text:
---
And this seeking judgment from 'Umar, by your own admission, is seeking judgment from ṭāghūt (false deity), who is the one rebuked in the noble verse. His partisans who sought retribution for his blood apologized that they only intended to bring about reconciliation and agreement between the disputants, not to adjudicate and rule in favor of whoever has the right against his opponent, and turning away from the Messenger of Allah by seeking judgment from him so that he would deserve to be killed and his blood shed in vain.
So how can your statement be correct? Ṭāghūt, in this case, is Ka'b ibn al-Ashraf. Rather, it is clear that ṭāghūt here is either 'Umar or 'Amr Ka'b ibn al-Ashraf both.
In short, anyone whom people want to seek judgment from instead of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, then it is not correct for you in the interpretation except to say that 'Umar was named as such (just as Ka'b ibn al-Ashraf was named metaphorically), because seeking judgment from him was seeking judgment from ṭāghūt (false deity), that is, Satan, because Satan was the one driving him, or because of the harshness and severity in him, so that was called "ṭughyān (transgression)" and the harsh, severe one "ṭāghūt (false deity)." And if ṭāghūt is plural as you said, and it is the correct view, due to His saying, "Their allies are ṭāghūt (false deities)," then it is not correct to apply it only to Ka'b ibn al-Ashraf.
Therefore, what you have attributed to Gabriel, peace be upon him, and made the reason for calling 'Umar "al-Fārūq (the distinguisher)" is not appropriate for the source of the station and the origin of eloquence.
Then I say: Your mufassir (exegetes), and your muhaddithūn (hadith narrators) have narrated that His saying, the Most High, "O you who have believed, enter into Islam completely [and perfectly] and do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy. But if you deviate after clear proofs have come to you, then know that Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise" (1) was revealed about 'Umar. So the hadith of tahawwuk (ruin) in that is widely known, famous, with varying texts, branched paths in your ṣaḥīḥ (authentic) sources, and explained by the explainers of hadith from your scholars.
The author of al-Kashshāf said in al-Fā'iq: The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, said to him, 'Umar: We hear hadiths from Jews that amaze us, do you think we should write some of them? He said: Are you intending to ruin yourselves? Just as the Jews ruined themselves.

 والنصارى، لقد جئتكم بها بيضاء نقية، ولو كان موسى حيا ما وسعه الا اتباعي. تهوك  وتهور أخوان في معنى وقع في الامر بغير روية، قال الأصمعي: المتهوك الذي يقع  في كل أمر وأنشد الكسائي:
 رآني امروءا لا هذرة متهوكا ولا واهنا شراب ماء المظالم  وقيل: التهوك والتهفك: الاضطراب في القول وأن لا يكون على استقامة،  الضمير في بها للملة الحنفية. انتهى كلام الفايق (1).
 وقال ابن الأثير في النهاية: في الحديث أنه صلى الله عليه وآله قال لعمر في كلام: أمتهو كون  أنتم كما تهوكت اليهود والنصارى لقد جئت بها بيضاء نقية، التهوك كالتهور وهو  الوقوع في الامر بغير رؤية، والمتهوك الذي يقع في كل أمر وقيل: هو المتحير، وفي  حديث آخر أن عمر أتاه بصحيفة أخذها من بعض أهل الكتاب فغضب وقال:
 أمتهو كون فيها يابن الخطاب. انتهى ما في النهاية (2).
 وأيضا اعتراض عمر على النبي صلى الله عليه وآله يوم الحديبية وشكه في الامر وقوله:
 ما شككت في ديني منذ أسلمت الا يومي هذا (3). من الصحيح الثابت في صحاحكم  الستة، وكذلك خطأه في كثير من أقضيته وأحكامه في زمن خلافته، فهو ليس يستحق  اسم الفاروق.
 بل أن الصديق الأكبر والفاروق الأعظم أمير المؤمنين علي بن أبي طالب عليه السلام  الذي هو ديان هذه الأمة بعد نبيها، أي قاضيها، ورباني هذه الأمة، وذو قرنيها، وباب  حطة هذه الأمة، وأقضى الناس في هذه الأمة، ومثله في الناس كمثل قل هو الله أحد  في القرآن، وهو مع الحق والحق معه يدور معه حيث ما دار، وقد صح وثبت

... and the Christians. I have brought it to you white and pure, and if Moses were alive, he would have no choice but to follow me." Tahawwuk and tahawwur are two words with the same meaning: falling into a matter without reflection. Al-Asma'i said: "Al-mutahawwik is the one who falls into every matter." And al-Kisa'i recited:

"He saw me as a man neither prone to nonsense (muthahwikan) nor a feeble drinker of the water of injustice."

And it was said: Al-tahawwuk and al-tahaffuk: is confusion in speech and not being upright. The pronoun " بها " (biha - with it) refers to the Ḥanīfī faith. End of al-Fayiq’s statement (1).

Ibn al-Athir said in al-Nihaya: "In the hadith, the Prophet (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) said to Omar in a conversation: ‘Are you mutahawwikun (behaving recklessly) as the Jews and Christians did? I have brought it white and pure.’ Al-tahawwuk is like al-tahawwur, which is falling into a matter without reflection. And al-mutahawwik is the one who falls into every matter. And it was said: He is the confused one. And in another hadith, Omar came to him with a page he had taken from some of the People of the Book, and he became angry and said: Are you mutahawwikun (behaving recklessly) in it, O Ibn al-Khattab.” End of what is in al-Nihaya (2).

Also, Omar's objection to the Prophet (peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family) on the day of al-Hudaybiyyah, his doubt in the matter, and his saying: "I have not doubted my religion since I converted, except on this day of mine (3)." is from the authentic (ṣaḥīḥ) and established in your six Sahihs. Likewise, his error in many of his judgments and rulings during his caliphate, so he does not deserve the name al-Farooq (the one who distinguishes between right and wrong).

Rather, the greatest al-Siddiq (truthful) and the greatest al-Farooq (the one who distinguishes between right and wrong) is Amir al-Mu'minin (Commander of the Believers) Ali ibn Abi Talib, peace be upon him, who is the judge of this nation after its Prophet, meaning its judge, and the learned scholar of this nation, and its possessor of two horns, and the door of forgiveness of this nation, and the most decisive of people in this nation, and his example among the people is like "Say, He is God, [who is] One" (Qur'an 112:1) in the Qur'an, and he is with the truth and the truth is with him, turning with him wherever he turns, and it has been authenticated and established...

من هؤلاء الثلاثة؟ فقال اني أخاف أن أساله فلا أكون منهم فتعيرني بذلك بنو عدي ثم جاء علي عليه السلام فقيل له: يا أبا الحسن ان رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله قال: إن الجنة مشتاق إلى ثلاثة فلو سألته من هؤلاء الثلاثة؟ فقال أسأله ان كنت منهم حمدت الله وان لم أكن منهم حمدت الله، قال، فقال علي عليه السلام يا رسول الله انك قلت إن الجنة لتشتاق إلى ثلاثة فمن هؤلاء الثلاثة؟ قال: أنت منهم وأنت أولهم، وسلمان الفارسي فإنه قليل الكبر وهو لك ناصح فاتخذه لنفسك، وعمار بن ياسر شهد معك مشاهد غير واحدة ليس منها الا وهو فيها، كثير خيره، ضوي نوره، عظيم أجره.
____________________
 واستبان واستفاض جميع ذلك في الحديث عن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله برواية أثبته الثقاة  عند العامة والخاصة (1)، وسيان في الاعتراف بذلك كله والعدو والولي واللاج الجدلي  والمتقن المبتغى لسواء السبيل فليتبصر.
 قوله: فتعيرني بذلك بنوا عدى  اقتدى بأبي بكر في مخافة التعيير وعدم الاكتراث للانحطاط عن هذه الدرجة.
 قوله صلى الله عليه وآله: أنت منهم وأنت أولهم  وفي المشكاة وصحيح الترمذي وغيرهما من صحاح العامة وأصولهم عن أنس  قال: قال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله: الجنة تشتاق إلى ثلاثة علي وعمار وسلمان (2).
 قوله: ضوي نوره  بتشديد الياء، وأصله ضوئ بالهمزة على فعيل للمبالغة من الضوء والضياء،  قلبت الهمزة ياءا وأدغمت الياء، في الياء كما تقلب وتدغم همزة الملي بمعنى الغني  المقتدر على فعيل من الملاءة، فيقال: ملي بتشديد الياء.
 وفي بعض النسخ " وضئ " بتقديم الواو على الضاد اما نقلا مكانيا فيكون أيضا

"Who are these three?" He said, "I fear to ask him, lest I not be among them, and the Banu 'Adi would taunt me for it." Then 'Ali (peace be upon him) came, and it was said to him, "O Abu al-Hasan, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said, 'Paradise yearns for three.' Why don't you ask him who these three are?" He said, "I will ask him; if I am among them, I will praise Allah, and if I am not among them, I will praise Allah." He said, so 'Ali (peace be upon him) said, "O Messenger of Allah, you said that Paradise yearns for three. Who are these three?" He said, "You are among them, and you are the first of them, and Salman al-Farisi, for he is little in arrogance and is a sincere advisor to you, so take him for yourself, and 'Ammar ibn Yasir, who witnessed battles with you, not one of which he was not in, abundant is his good, radiant is his light, and great is his reward."
____________________
All of this has become clear and widespread in the hadith about the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) through the narration of established thiqāt (trustworthy) among the general public and the elite (1), and the enemy, the friend, the obstinate debater, and the proficient seeker of the straight path are equal in acknowledging all of that, so let him see clearly.
His saying: "The Banu 'Adi would taunt me for it" he imitated Abu Bakr in fearing taunts and not caring about falling from this degree.
His saying (peace and blessings be upon him and his family): "You are among them, and you are the first of them" and in al-Mishkat and Sahih al-Tirmidhi and other authentic books and sources of the general public on the authority of Anas, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him and his family) said: "Paradise yearns for three: 'Ali, 'Ammar, and Salman (2)."
His saying: "ضوي نوره" *ḍuwayyi nūruhū* (radiant is his light) with a shadda on the *ya*, its origin is *ḍawʾ* with a hamza on the scale of *faʿīl* for emphasis from light and radiance. text:
59 - محمد بن مسعود، قال حدثني جعفر بن أحمد، قال حدثنا حمدان بن سليمان النيسابوري والعمركي بن علي البوفكي النيسابوري، عن محمد بن عيسى عن يونس بن عبد الرحمن، عن عبد الله الحجال، عن علي بن عقبة، عن رجل، عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: كان رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله وعلي وعمار يعملون مسجدا فمر عثمان في بزة له يخطر فقال له أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام: أرجز به فقال عمار:
____________________
 فعيلا من الضوء، واما على أنه فعيل من الوضاءة وهي الحسن والبهجة والبهاء  والنضرة.
 وفي النهاية الأثيرية: الوضاءة الحسن والبهجة، يقال وضأت فهي وضيئة،  وهي أوضأ منك، أي أحسن (1).
 وفي المغرب: الوضئ الحسن النظيف، وقد وضأ وضاءة وتوضأ وضوءا  حسنا بوضوء طاهر، بالضم المصدر، وبالفتح الماء الذي يتوضأ به، والميضأة  والميضاءة على مفعلة ومفعالة المطهرة التي يتوضأ فيها أو منها.
 قوله رحمه الله: حمدان بن سليمان النيسابوري والعمركي بن علي  البوفكي  السند جليل جدا، وعالي الاسناد في الطبقة الثانية، وصحي بيونس بن  عبد الرحمن عن رجل، وإن كان المرسل عن رجل هو علي بن عقبة، لا يونس بن  عبد الرحمن فليعلم.
 قوله عليه السلام: فمر عثمان في بزة له يخطر  بكسر الموحدة وتشديد الزاء، أي في ثوب تجمل، يقال: خرجوا وعليهم  الخزوز والبزوز أي الثياب الجياد قاله في الأساس (2).
 وقال في المغرب: البزة بالهاء وكسر الباء الهيئة من قولهم رجل حسن البزة

59 - Muhammad bin Mas'ud, said: Ja'far bin Ahmad narrated to me, said: Hamdan bin Sulaiman al-Naysaburi and al-'Umraki bin 'Ali al-Bufki al-Naysaburi narrated to us, from Muhammad bin 'Isa from Yunus bin 'Abd al-Rahman, from 'Abd Allah al-Hajjal, from 'Ali bin 'Uqba, from a man, from Abi 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family), 'Ali, and 'Ammar were working on a mosque when 'Uthman passed by in a garment of his, strutting. So Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him) said to him: "Sing to it!" So 'Ammar said:
____________________
fa'īl (form) of light, or that it is fa'īl (form) of al-wada'a, which is beauty, radiance, splendor, and freshness.
And in al-Nihaya al-Athiriya: Al-wada'a is beauty and radiance. It is said "wadu'at" so she is wadi'a, and "she is awda'u than you" meaning more beautiful (1).
And in al-Maghrib: Al-wadi' is the beautiful and clean, and it has been said "wadu'a wada'atan wa tawadda'a wudu'an hasanan bi wudu'in tahir," with the damma being the source, and with the fatha the water with which one performs ablution, and al-midha'a and al-midhaa'a are on the scales of mif'ala and mif'ala, the purifier in which or from which one performs ablution.
His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: Hamdan bin Sulaiman al-Naysaburi and al-'Umraki bin 'Ali al-Bufki. The chain is very noble, and the isnād (chain of narration) is high in the second layer, and it is sound by Yunus bin 'Abd al-Rahman from a man, even if the mursal (interrupted transmission) from a man is 'Ali bin 'Uqba, not Yunus bin 'Abd al-Rahman, so let it be known.
His saying, peace be upon him: "Uthman passed by in a garment of his, strutting" with a kasra on the ba' and a shadda on the za', meaning in a garment of adornment. It is said: "They came out and they were wearing al-khuzuz and al-buzuz" meaning fine clothes, as stated in al-Asas (2).
And he said in al-Maghrib: al-Bizza with a ha' and a kasra on the ba', meaning the appearance, from their saying "a man of good appearance."

text:
لا يستوى من يعمر المساجد * يظل فيها راكعا وساجدا ومن تراه عاندا معاندا * عن العباد لا يزال حائدا ____________________
 وقيل: هي الثياب والسلاح.
 وفي القاموس: البز الثياب، أو متاع البيت من الثياب ونحوها، وبايعه البزاز  وحرفته البزازة والسلاح كالبزة بالكسر (1).
 و" يخطر " بفتح ياء المضارعة وكسر الطاء المهملة بعد الخاء المعجمة، أي  يهتز ويرفع يديه في مشيته، وناقة خطارة تحرك ذنبها إذا نشطت في السير قاله في  الأساس والقاموس وغيرهما (2).
 وفي الصحاح: خطران الرجل اهتزازه في المشي وتبختره، وخطر الرمح  يخطر اهتز، ورمح خطار ذو اهتزاز، ويقال: خطران الرمح ارتفاعه وانخفاضه (3).
 قوله رضى الله تعالى عنه: يظل فيها راكعا وساجدا  ظل يفعل كذا يظل بالكسر في الماضي والفتح في المضارع من باب علم.
 قال في القاموس: ظل نهاره يفعل كذا وليله سمع في الشعر يظل بالفتح ظلا  وظلولا وظللت بالكسر وظلت كلست وظلت كملت، وأصله ظللت (4).
 وفي الصحاح: ومنه قوله تعالى " فظلتم تفكهون " يكسر ويفتح وأصله وظللتم  تفكهون، فهو من شواذ التخفيف ومنه قولهم: مست الشئ يحذفون منه السين الأولى  ويحولون كسرتها إلى الميم، ومنهم من يذر الميم على حالها مفتوحة (5).
footnote: (١) القاموس: ٢ / ١٦٦ ٢) أساس البلاغة: ١٦٨ والقاموس: ٢ / ٢٢ ٣) الصحاح: ٢ / ٦٤٨ ٤) القاموس: ٤ / ١٠ ٥) الصحاح: ٥ / 1756

"Not equal are those who maintain the mosques, * Remaining therein, bowing and prostrating, And he whom you see obstinate and opposing, * Away from the servants, ever deviating."
And it was said: It refers to clothes and weapons.
In Al-Qamus: Al-Bazz means clothes, or household goods of clothes and the like, and al-Bazzaz buys and sells them, and his profession is al-Bazaza, and weapons are like al-Bizza with a kasrah (1).
And "yakhṭaru" with the opening of the ya' al-muḍāra'a and the kasrah of the ṭā' al-muhmala after the khā' al-mu'jama, meaning he shakes and raises his hands in his walk, and a nāqa khaṭāra (a camel that moves its tail when it becomes active in walking), as stated in Al-Asas and Al-Qamus and others (2).
In Al-Sahah: Khiṭrān al-rajul is a man's shaking in his walk and strutting, and the spear trembled, yakhtaru (it trembles), and a spear khiṭār (a spear that trembles), and it is said: Khiṭrān al-rumḥ is its rising and falling (3).
His saying, may Allah be pleased with him: "Remaining therein, bowing and prostrating." Ẓalla yaf'alu kadha yaẓillu with a kasrah in the past and a fatha in the present from the bab of 'alima.
He said in Al-Qamus: Ẓalla nahāruhu yaf'alu kadha wa layluhu (He spent his day and night doing such and such), it is heard in poetry yaẓallu with a fatha ẓallan wa ẓulūlan and ẓaliltu with a kasrah and ẓallat kalist wa ẓallat kamulat (He remained) and its origin is ẓaliltu (4).
And in Al-Sahah: And from it is His saying, may He be exalted: "Fa ẓalltum tafakkahūn" (So you remained amused), it is broken and opened, and its origin is wa ẓaliltum tafakkahūn, so it is from the anomalies of reduction, and from it is their saying: Must al-shay' (Touched the thing), they delete the first sin from it and convert its kasrah to the mim, and some of them leave the mim in its opened state (5).

قال، فأتي النبي صلى الله عليه وآله فقال ما أسلمنا لتشتم أعراضنا وأنفسنا! فقال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله أفتحب أن تقال؟ فنزلت آيتان " ينمون عليك أن أسلموا " الآية، ثم قال النبي صلى الله عليه وآله لعلي عليه السلام: اكتب هذا في صاحبك: ثم قال النبي صلى الله عليه وآله: اكتب هذه الآية: انما المؤمنون الذين آمنوا بالله ورسوله.
60 - جعفر بن معروف، قال حدثنا الحسن بن علي بن نعمان، عن أبيه، عن صالح الحذاء، قال لما أمر النبي صلى الله عليه وآله ببناء المسجد قسم عليهم المواضع وضم إلى كل رجل رجلا، فضم عمارا إلى علي عليه السلام قال فبينا هم في علاج البناء إذ خرج عثمان من داره وارتفع الغبار فتمنع بثوبه وعرض بوجهه، قال، فقال علي عليه السلام لعمار إذا قلت شيئا فرد علي قال، فقال علي عليه السلام:
لا يستوى من يعمر المساجد * يظل فيها راكعا وساجدا كمن يري عن الطريق عائدا.
____________________
 قوله صلى الله عليه وآله: أفتحب أن تقال  أي أن تذكر عند الناس بهذه المقالة وينسب إليك هذا القول، أو أن تكون  مكتوبا عند الله بها وتكتبها الكتبة عليك وتثبتها في صحيفة عملك.
 قوله صلى الله عليه وآله: اكتب هذا في صاحبك  أي في عمار، وهذا إشارة إلى ما أمر بكتبته وهو " انما المؤمنون الذين آمنوا  بالله ورسوله (1) " أوفي عثمان فيكون هذا إشارة إلى " يمنون عليك أن أسلموا (2) "  والمعنى: اكتب يمنون عليك أن أسلموا في عثمان وانما المؤمنون الذين  آمنوا في عمار.
 قوله عليه السلام: فتمنع بثوبه  أي تأبه وتعزز، وتفعلا من المنعة بالتحريك، أو بالتسكين أيضا بمعنى العز،

He said, so he came to the Prophet, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, and said, "We did not become Muslims so that our honor and our souls would be insulted!" The Messenger of God, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, said, "Would you like it to be said?" Then two verses were revealed, "They remind you of a favor that they have accepted Islam." The Prophet, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, then said to Ali, peace be upon him: "Write this about your companion." Then the Prophet, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, said: "Write this verse: 'The believers are those who believe in God and His Messenger.'"
60 - Ja'far bin Ma'ruf said, "Al-Hasan bin Ali bin Nu'man narrated to us, from his father, from Salih al-Hadhdha', who said: 'When the Prophet, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, ordered the building of the mosque, he divided the places among them and joined each man to another man. So he joined Ammar to Ali, peace be upon him. He said, while they were working on the building, Uthman came out of his house and the dust rose, so he shielded himself with his garment and turned his face away. He said, Ali, peace be upon him, said to Ammar, "If I say something, respond to me." Ali, peace be upon him, said:

"Not equal are those who build the mosques, * Remaining therein bowing and prostrating,
To one who turns away from the path, returning."'"

His saying, peace and blessings of God be upon him: "Would you like it to be said?" meaning to be mentioned among the people with this statement and attributed to you this saying, or to be written with God and recorded by the scribes against you and affirmed in the record of your deeds.
His saying, peace and blessings of God be upon him: "Write this about your companion" meaning about Ammar, and this is a reference to what he ordered to be written, which is "The believers are those who believe in God and His Messenger (1)" or about Uthman, so this would be a reference to "They remind you of a favor that they have accepted Islam (2)" and the meaning is: Write "They remind you of a favor that they have accepted Islam" about Uthman, and "The believers are those who believe" about Ammar.
His saying, peace be upon him: "So he shielded himself with his garment" meaning he disdained and acted proudly, and it is a form of *al-mana'a* with a vowel mark, or with a pause, also meaning pride.

text:
قال: فأجابه عمار كما قال: فغضب عثمان من ذلك فلم يستطيع أن يقول لعلي شيئا. فقال لعمار يا عبد يا لكع! ومضى. فقال علي عليه السلام لعمار رضيت بما قال لك، ألا تأتي النبي صلى الله عليه وآله فتخبره، قال، فأتاه فأخبره، فقال يا نبي الله ان عثمان قال لي يا عبد يا لكع، فقال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله من يعلم ذلك؟ فقال علي. فدعاه وسأله، قال، فقال له كما قال عمار، فقال لعلي عليه السلام فقال له حيث ما كان يا عبد يا لكع أنت القائل لعمار يا عبد يا لكع، فذهب علي عليه السلام فقال له ذلك ثم انصرف.
61 - جعفر بن معروف، قال حدثني محمد بن الحسن، عن جعفر بن بشير، عن حسين بن أبي حمزة، عن أبيه أبي حمزة، قال والله انى لعلى ظهر بعيري بالبقيع إذ جاءني رسول فقال: أجب يا أبا حمزة، فجئت وأبو عبد الله عليه السلام جالس، فقال انى لأستريح إذا رأيتك، ثم قال: إن أقواما يزعمون أن عليا عليه السلام ____________________
 و" عرض بوجهه " بالتشديد، أي أعرض على التفعيل بمعنى الافعال، وفي  بعض النسخ " أعرض ".
 قوله عليه السلام: فقال لعمار: يا عبد يا لكع  في الصحاح: رجل لكع أي لئيم، ويقال: هو العبد الذليل النفس، وامرأة  لكاع مثل قطام، تقول في النداء: يا لكع للاثنين يا ذوي لكع (1).
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: جعفر بن معروف قال: حدثني  السند صحيح نقي، ومحمد بن الحسن هو ابن أبي الخطاب، وجعفر بن  بشير هو قفة العلم، وحسين بن أبي حمزة هو ابن أبي حمزة الثمالي، عن أبيه أبي  حمزة ثابت بن دينار أبي صفية.
 قوله عليه السلام: ان أقواما يزعمون  يعني عليه السلام بهم الزيدية المشرطين في الإمامة الخروج بالسيف.

He said: 'Ammar responded as he did, so 'Uthman became angry at that but could not say anything to 'Ali. So he said to 'Ammar, "O slave, O base one!" and left. So 'Ali (peace be upon him) went and said that to him, then left.
61 - Ja'far ibn Ma'ruf said: Muhammad ibn al-Hasan narrated to me, from Ja'far ibn Bashir, from Husayn ibn Abi Hamza, from his father Abu Hamza, who said: "By Allah, I was on the back of my camel in al-Baqi' when a messenger came to me and said: 'Answer, O Abu Hamza!' text:
لم يكن إماما حتى شهر سيفه، خاب إذا عمار وخزيمة بن ثابت وصاحبك أبو عمرة، وقد خرج يومئذ صائما بين الفئتين بأسهم فرماها قربي يتقرب بها إلى الله تعالى حتى قتل، يعني عمارا.
____________________
 قوله عليه السلام: حتى شهر سيفه  في الصحاح وغيره: شهر سيفه يشهره شهرا: أي سله (1).
 وفي المغرب: أشهره بمعنى شهره غير ثبت.
 قوله عليه السلام: خاب اذن عمار خزيمة بن ثابت وصاحبك أبو عمرة  وكذلك أبو ذر وسلمان والمقداد وحذيفة وغيرهم من السابقين، إذ كان علي  عليه السلام امامهم حين إذ لم يشهر سيفه.
 قوله عليه السلام: وقد خرج يومئذ صائما بين الفئتين بأسهم  أي قائما واقفا ثابتا للقتال، من الصوم بمعنى القيام والوقوف يقال: صام  الفرس صوما أي قام غير اعتلاف، وصام النهار صوما إذا قام قائم الظهيرة  واعتدل، والصوم ركود الريح، ومصام الفرس ومصامته موقفه.
 والصوم أيضا الثبات والدوام والسكون والسكوت وماء صائم ودائم وقائم  وساكن بمعنى.
 والباء في بأسهم للملابسة والمصاحبة. أو خرج بين الفئتين وكان صائما من  الصوم المصطلح بمعنى الصيام الشرعي، والباء أيضا للملابسة.
 أو من الصوم بمعنى البيعة، أي خرج مبايعا على بذل المهجة في سبيل الله،  أو خرج بين صفي الفئتين راميا بأسهم، من قولهم صام النعام أي رمى بذرقه وهو  صومه، فالباء أيضا للصلة أو للدعامة، فقد جاء الصوم بهذه المعاني كلها في الصحاح  وأساس البلاغة والمعرب والمغرب والقاموس والنهاية (2).
footnote: (١) الصحاح: ٢ / 705 2) أساس البلاغة: 365 ونهاية ابن الأثير: 3 / 61
translation:

He was not an Imam until he drew his sword. 'Ammār, Khuzaymah ibn Thābit, and your companion Abu 'Umrah would have failed, for he went out that day fasting between the two factions with arrows, throwing them as an offering to Allah Almighty until he was killed, meaning 'Ammār.
____________________
His saying (peace be upon him), "until he drew his sword": In al-Ṣiḥāḥ and elsewhere: "Shahara sayfahu yashharuhu shahran": meaning he unsheathed it (1).
And in al-Maghrib: "Ashharahu" with the meaning of "shaharahu" is not established.
His saying (peace be upon him), "Ammār, Khuzaymah ibn Thābit, and your companion Abu 'Umrah would have failed": and likewise Abu Dharr, Salmān, al-Miqdād, Hudhayfah, and others of the early Muslims, since 'Alī (peace be upon him) was their Imam when he had not yet drawn his sword.
His saying (peace be upon him), "for he went out that day fasting between the two factions with arrows": meaning standing, pausing, steadfast for battle, from "al-ṣawm" meaning standing and pausing. It is said: "Ṣāma al-faras ṣawman" meaning the horse stood without grazing, and "Ṣāma al-nahār ṣawman" if the height of the day stood and was balanced. And "al-ṣawm" is the stillness of the wind, and "maṣām al-faras" and "maṣāmatuhu" is its standing place.
And "al-ṣawm" is also steadfastness, continuity, tranquility, silence, and "mā' ṣā'im" is permanent, lasting, standing, and still, with the same meaning.
The "bā" in "bi ashum" (with arrows) is for association and accompaniment. Or, he went out between the two factions and was fasting, from "al-ṣawm" in the established meaning of religious fasting, and the "bā" is also for association.
Or, from "al-ṣawm" meaning allegiance, i.e., he went out pledging to sacrifice his soul in the path of Allah, or he went out between the ranks of the two factions shooting arrows, from their saying "Ṣāma al-na'ām" meaning the ostrich threw its dung, and that is its "ṣawm," so the "bā" is also for connection or support, for "al-ṣawm" has come in all these meanings in al-Ṣiḥāḥ, Asās al-Balāghah, al-Mu'arrab, al-Maghrib, al-Qāmūs, and al-Nihāyah (2).

text:
62 - ومن طريق العامة: خلف بن محمد الملقب بمنان الكشي، قال حدثنا محمد بن حميد، قال حدثنا أبو نعيم، قال حدثنا سفيان، عن سلمة، عن مجاهد، قال رآهم وهم يحملون حجارة المسجد فقال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله مالهم ولعمار يدعوهم إلى الجنة ويدعونه إلى النار، وذاك دار الأشقياء الفجار.
63 - خلف بن محمد، قال حدثنا عبيد بن حميد، قال حدثنا هاشم بن القاسم، قال حدثنا شعبة، عن إسماعيل بن أبي خالد، قال سمعت قيس بن أبي حازم، قال، قال عمار بن ياسر: ادفنوني في ثيابي فاني مخاصم.
64 - خلف بن محمد، قال حدثنا عبيد بن حميد قال أخبرنا أبو نعيم، قال حدثنا سفيان، عن حبيب، عن أبي البختري، قال: أتي عمار يومئذ بلبن، فضحك، ____________________
 قوله: رآهم  يعني رآهم رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله وهم يحملون حجارة المسجد فأعجبه اهتراز عمار  واخلاصه في العمل، فكأنه صلى الله عليه وآله استذكر ما كان يعلمه بالوحي من أمر الخلافة بعده  وما يصيب عمارا في قتال الفئة الباغية فاستحضر الحال فقال: مالهم ولعمار يدعوهم  إلى الجنة ويدعونه إلى النار، يعني بهم الفئة الباغية من القاسطين.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: عن حبيب  قال أبو عبد الله الذهبي من علماء العامة في ميزان الاعتدال: حبيب بن أبي  ثابت من ثقاة التابعين.
 وقال في مختصرة في الرجال: حبيب بن أبي ثابت الأسدي عن ابن عباس  وزيد بن أرقم، وعنه شعبة وسفيان وأمم، كان ثقة مجتهدا فقيها مات 119.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: عن أبي البختري  اسمه سعيد بن فيروز على الأشهر، ذكره البرقي في أصحاب علي عليه السلام من

62 - And from the way of the general populace: Khalaf ibn Muhammad, nicknamed Manan al-Kashshi, said: Muhammad ibn Humayd narrated to us, who said: Abu Nu'aym narrated to us, who said: Sufyan narrated to us, from Salama, from Mujahid, who said: He saw them carrying the stones of the mosque, and the Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, said: "What is wrong with them and 'Ammar? He invites them to Paradise, and they invite him to the Fire, and that is the abode of the wretched, immoral ones."
63 - Khalaf ibn Muhammad said: 'Ubayd ibn Humayd narrated to us, who said: Hashim ibn al-Qasim narrated to us, who said: Shu'ba narrated to us, from Isma'il ibn Abi Khalid, who said: I heard Qays ibn Abi Hazim say: 'Ammar ibn Yasir said, "Bury me in my clothes, for I am an adversary."
64 - Khalaf ibn Muhammad said: 'Ubayd ibn Humayd narrated to us, who said: Abu Nu'aym informed us, who said: Sufyan narrated to us, from Habib, from Abu al-Bakhtari, who said: 'Ammar was brought milk that day, and he laughed,

His saying: "He saw them" means that the Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, saw them carrying the stones of the mosque and was impressed by 'Ammar's zeal and sincerity in the work. He invites them to Paradise, and they invite him to the Fire," meaning by them the rebellious group of the unjust.
His saying, may God have mercy on him: From Habib Abu Abdullah al-Dhahabi, one of the scholars of the general populace, said in Mizan al-I'tidal: Habib ibn Abi Thabit is one of the thiqa (trustworthy) of the Tabi'in.

65 - خلف بن محمد، قال حدثنا عبيد، قال حدثنا أبو نعيم، قال حدثنا سفيان عن أبي قيس الأودي، عن الهزيل، قال للنبي صلى الله عليه وآله ان عمارا سقط عليه جدار ____________________
 ومن المجاز: فلان يمذق الود ووده ممذوق وهو ممذوق الود (1).
 وفي النهاية الأثيرية: المذق المزج والخلط، يقال، مذقت اللبن فهو مذيق إذا  خلطته بالماء والمذقة الشربة من اللبن الممذوق انتهى (2).
 وفى القاصرين من يحسب الميم زائدة، والصيغة مأخوذة من ذاق الشئ  يذوقه ذوقا ومذاقا، وذلك حسبان فاسد فساده غير خاف على المتمهر.
 قوله صلى الله عليه وآله: في خبر آخر ضياح من لبن  بفتح الضاد المعجمة والياء المثناة من تحت واهمال الحاء بعد الألف، وهو  اللبن الرقيق الممزوج، وكذلك الضيح بالفتح، وضيحت اللبن تضييحا وضوحته  تضويحا مزجته بالماء حتى صار ضيحا وضياحا، وضيحت فلانا وضوحه سقيته  الضيح والضياح.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: عن أبي قيس الأودي عن الهزيل:
 بضم الهاء وفتح الزاء على تصغير الهزل.
 قال الذهبي في مختصره: عبد الرحمن بن ثروان أبو قيس الأودي عن شريح  وسويد بن غفلة وعنه صفوان وشعبة ثقة توفى 125.
 وقال ابن الأثير في جامع الأصول: هزيل هو هزيل بن شرحبيل الأودي الكوفي سمع  عبد الله بن مسعود، روى عنه أبو قيس عبد الرحمن بن ثروان وطلحة بن  مصرف وغيرهما، هزيل بضم الهاء وفتح الزاء. وشرحبيل بضم الشين المعجمة

And in another account: He said to him, "The last of your provision from this world will be *ḍiyāḥ* of milk."

65 - Khalaf bin Muhammad said: Ubaid narrated to us, he said: Abu Nu'aim narrated to us, he said: Sufyan narrated to us from Abu Qais al-Awdi, from al-Huzayl, who said to the Prophet, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, "A wall fell on 'Ammar..."
____________________
From the figurative: So-and-so adulterates affection, and his affection is adulterated, and he is one whose affection is adulterated (1).

In *al-Nihayah al-Athiriyah*: *Al-Madhq* is mixing and blending. It is said, "I *madhaqtu* the milk, so it is *mudhiq*," if you mix it with water, and *al-midhqah* is a sip of diluted milk, end quote (2).

And among the deficient in knowledge are those who consider the *mīm* to be extra, and the form is taken from *dhāqa al-shay’ yadhūquhu dhawqan wa madhāqan*, and that is a corrupt calculation, the corruption of which is not hidden from the skilled.

His saying, peace and blessings of God be upon him and his family, in another account, "*ḍiyāḥ* of milk" - with a *fatḥah* on the *ḍād mu’jamah* (ض) and the *yā’ muthannāh min taḥt* (ي) and neglecting the *ḥā’* after the *alif*, and it is thin, diluted milk. Likewise, *al-ḍayḥ* with a *fatḥah*. And I *ḍayyaḥtu al-laban taḍyīḥan* and *ḍawwaḥtuhu taḍwīḥan*: I mixed it with water until it became *ḍayḥan* and *ḍiyāḥan*. And I *ḍayyaḥtu fulānan wa ḍawwaḥahu*: I gave so-and-so *al-ḍayḥ* and *al-ḍiyāḥ* to drink.

His saying, may God have mercy on him: From Abu Qais al-Awdi from al-Huzayl:

With a *ḍammah* on the *hā’* and a *fatḥah* on the *zā’* in the diminutive form of *al-hazl*.

Al-Dhahabi said in his abridgement: Abd al-Rahman bin Tharwan Abu Qais al-Awdi, from Shuraih and Suwaid bin Ghaflah, and from him, Safwan and Shu'bah: *thiqa* (trustworthy), died in 125 AH.

And Ibn al-Athir said in *Jami' al-Usul*: Huzayl is Huzayl bin Shurahbil al-Awdi al-Kufi, he heard Abdullah bin Masoud, Abu Qais Abd al-Rahman bin Tharwan and Talha bin Musarrif and others narrated from him. Huzayl with a *ḍammah* on the *hā’* and a *fatḥah* on the *zā’*. And Shurahbil with a *ḍammah* on the *shīn mu'jamah* (ش)...

66 - خلف، قال حدثنا فتح بن عمرو الوارق، قال حدثنا يحيى بن آدم، قال حدثنا إسرائيل وسفيان، عن أبي إسحاق، ____________________
 وفتح الراء. وثروان بفتح الثاء المثلثة وبالنون ومصرف بضم الميم وفتح الصاد  المهملة وتشديد الراء المكسورة.
 وفي القاموس: هزيل كزبير ابن شرحبيل تابعي (1).
 قوله صلى الله عليه وآله: ان عمارا لن يموت  يعني عمارا لا يموت بل يقتل في سبيل الله تقتله الفئة الباغية، أو أنه لن يموت  أبدا لقوله سبحانه " ولا تحسبن الذين قتلوا في سبيل الله أمواتا بل أحياء عند ربهم  يرزقون فرحين بما آتاهم الله من فضله " (2).
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: قال: حدثنا إسرائيل  في مختصر الذهبي وفي ميزان الاعتدال: إسرائيل بن يونس بن أبي  إسحاق السبيعي أحد الاعلام، عن جده وزياد بن علاقة وآدم بن علي، وعنه يحيى بن  آدم ومحمد بن كثير وأمم، قال: أحفظ حديث أبي إسحاق كما أحفظ سورة من  القرآن، وقال أحمد بن حنبل: ثقة، وقال أبو حاتم: صدوق من أتقن أصحاب أبي  إسحاق توفى 162.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: عن أبي إسحاق  هذا هو أبو إسحاق السبيعي اسمه عمرو بن عبد الله يروي عنه سفيان.
 قال الكرماني في شرح صحيح البخاري: عمرو بن عبد الله بفتح المهملة  الكوفي (3).

"...and he died." Then he (the Prophet) said, "Indeed, 'Ammar will not die."
66 - Khalaf said: Fath bin 'Amr al-Warraq narrated to us, he said: Yahya bin Adam narrated to us, he said: Isra'il and Sufyan narrated to us, from Abi Ishaq,
____________________
And Fath with a fatha on the ra. and Tharuwan with a fatha on the tha' al-muthallatha and with a nun, and Musarraf with a damma on the meem and a fatha on the sad al-muhmala and a shadda on the ra with a kasra.
And in al-Qamus: Huzayl like Zubayr bin Shurahbil, a Tabi'i (1).
His saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "Indeed, 'Ammar will not die" means that 'Ammar will not die a natural death, but rather he will be killed in the path of Allah, and the rebellious group will kill him, or that he will never die, due to His saying, glory be to Him: "And never think of those who have been killed in the cause of Allah as dead. Rather, they are alive with their Lord, receiving provision, rejoicing in what Allah has bestowed upon them of His bounty" (2).
His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: He said: Isra'il narrated to us. In Mukhtasar al-Dhahabi and in Mizan al-I'tidal: Isra'il bin Yunus bin Abi Ishaq al-Subay'i, one of the prominent figures, from his grandfather and Ziyad bin 'Alaqa and Adam bin Ali, and from him Yahya bin Adam and Muhammad bin Kathir and many others. He said: "I memorize the hadith of Abi Ishaq as I memorize a surah from the Qur'an." Ahmad bin Hanbal said: thiqa (trustworthy), and Abu Hatim said: saduq (truthful), one of the most proficient companions of Abi Ishaq, he died in 162 AH.
His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: From Abi Ishaq. This is Abu Ishaq al-Subay'i, his name is 'Amr bin 'Abd Allah, and Sufyan narrates from him.
Al-Kirmani said in Sharh Sahih al-Bukhari: 'Amr bin 'Abd Allah with a fatha on the alif al-Kufi (3).
