They were perplexed when they fought the Imam of Truth, and that battle is known as the Day of Ṣiffīn. As for the *māriqūn* (those who deviated), they *maraqū* (deviated), meaning they departed from the religion of God and deemed lawful (1) fighting against the Caliph of the Messenger of God. They were 'Abd Allāh ibn Wahb al-Rāsibī and Ḥurqūṣ ibn Zuhayr al-Bajalī, known as "Dhū al-Thudayya." That battle is known as the Day of al-Nahrāwān, which is in the land of Iraq, four *farāsikh* from Baghdad. End quote from al-Muṭarrizī, in his words.

In a few versions, it is written "bi-al-Sa'afāt," meaning in a land with *sa'afāt* with a vowel mark on the second letter, which is the plural of *sa'af* with a vowel mark on the second letter. Both *bā*'s are for the purpose of indicating place.

It says in *al-Maghrib*: *al-Sa'af* is the leaves of palm branches from which baskets and fans are woven. Al-Layth said: It is mostly called *al-Sa'af* when it is dry, and when it is fresh, it is *al-shataba*. The palm branch itself may be called *sa'af*, the singular being *sa'afah*.

In *al-Ṣiḥāḥ*: *al-Sa'fah* with a vowel mark on the second letter, is a branch of the palm tree, and the plural is *sa'af* (2).

Supporting this version is the fact that the Khārijites, may God curse them, were in al-Rumayla' when the Commander of the Believers (peace be upon him) overlooked them. He fought them and killed them, then he encamped in al-Nukhayla', both diminutive forms.

It says in *al-Qāmūs*: Like Juhayna, a place in the desert and a place in Iraq where 'Alī (peace be upon him) fought the Khārijites (3).

Al-Mas'ūdī (may God have mercy on him) said in *Murūj al-Dhahab*: The messenger of the Khārijites to 'Alī (peace be upon him) reported that the people had crossed the river of Ṭukhāristān (4). This river has a bridge known as the Bridge of Ṭukhāristān to this day, located between Ḥulwān and Baghdad on the road to Ṭukhāristān. 'Alī (peace be upon him) said: By God, they have not crossed and will not cross it until we kill them in al-Rumayla' before it.

وما أدري أنى هي.
____________________
 ثم تواترت عليه الاخبار بقطعهم هذا النهر وعبورهم هذا الجسر، وهو يأبي  ذلك ويحلف أنهم لم يعبروه وأن مصارعهم دونه، ثم قال: سيروا إلى القوم فوالله  لا يفلت منهم الا عشرة ولا تقتل منكم الا عشرة فسار علي عليه السلام فأشرف عليهم وقد  عسكروا بالموضع المعروف بالرميلة على حسب ما قال لا صحابه.
 فلما أشرف عليهم قال: الله أكبر صدق الله ورسوله صلى الله عليه وآله فتصاب القوم  فوقف عليهم عليه السلام بنفسه فدعاهم إلى الرجوع والتوبة، فأبوا ورموا أصحابه، ثم بعد  ذكر القتال وقتلهم عن آخرهم الا عشرة منهم وقتل مخدج وصفته ووقوع كل ما أخبر به  علي عليه السلام علي طباق ما قد أخبر به عليه السلام.
 قال: فعسكر عليه السلام بالنخيلة فجعل أصحابه يتسللون ويلحقون بأوطانهم، فلم  يبق معه الا نفر يسير (1).
 قوله رضي الله عنه: وما أدري أنى هي  أني بفتح الهمزة وتشديد النون المفتوحة بعدها ظرفية، أي ما أدري أين تكون  هذه المسعفات الصاقبات من الطرقات أو أين تكون هذه السعفات أي جرائد النخل  بالطرقات.
 وفي بعض النسخ " أي هي " بالياء المشددة المنونة بالرفع بعد الهمزة المفتوحة  أي ما أدري مكان هي.
 في مروج الذهب: ان أول من قاتل من أصحاب أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام يوم  النهروان أبو أيوب الأنصاري حمل على زيد بن حصين من الخوارج فقتله (2)،

And I do not know where it is.
____________________
Then news poured in confirming their crossing of this river and their passage over this bridge, but he refused to believe it, swearing that they had not crossed and that their destruction lay before it. Then he said: "Proceed towards the people, for by God, none shall escape from them except ten, and none shall be killed from you except ten." So Ali (peace be upon him) proceeded and overlooked them as they camped at the place known as al-Rumayla, according to what he had told his companions.
When he overlooked them, he said: "Allah is the greatest, Allah and His Messenger (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family) have spoken the truth." So the people were afflicted. Then he (peace be upon him) stood before them himself and called them to return and repent, but they refused and threw stones at his companions. Then, after mentioning the fighting and their killing to the last man except ten of them, and the killing of Mikhdaj, his description, and the occurrence of everything that Ali (peace be upon him) had foretold, exactly as he (peace be upon him) had foretold.
He said: So he (peace be upon him) encamped at al-Nukhayla, and his companions began to slip away and return to their homelands, until only a few remained with him (1).
His saying, may Allah be pleased with him: "And I do not know where it is." "Anni" with a fatha on the hamza and a shadda on the nun with a fatha after it is adverbial, meaning I do not know where these accurate, piercing (arrows) are from the roads, or where these سعفات (sa'afat) are, meaning palm branches by the roads.
And in some versions, "Ayyu hiya" with a shadda and tanwin of raf' after the hamza with a fatha, meaning I do not know the place of "hiya".
In Muruj al-Dhahab: The first to fight from the companions of Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him) on the day of al-Nahrawan was Abu Ayyub al-Ansari. He charged at Zayd ibn Husayn from the Khawarij and killed him (2).

text:
حذيفة وعبد الله بن مسعود 78 - وسأل عن ابن مسعود وحذيفة؟ فقال: لم يكن حذيفة مثل ابن مسعود ____________________
 أم عبد، وسخطت لها ما سخط لها ابن أم عبد (1).
 وكان خفيف اللحم قصيرا شديد الأدمة، يكاد طوال (2) الرجل يوازيه جلوسا  ولي القضاء بالكوفة وبيت مالها لعمر وصدرا من خلافة عثمان، ثم صار إلى المدينة  فمات بها سنة اثنين وثلاثين، ودفن بالبقيع، وله بضع وستون سنة.
 حذيفة بن يمان أبو عبد الله العبسي من عظماء الصحابة ومن الأركان الأربعة  في الاستقامة مع علي عليه السلام بعد رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله على قول، وقد أسلفنا ترجمته وما ينبغي  أن يذكر في معناه (3).
 واليمان اسمه حسيل بن جابر بن ربيعة العبسي، حسيل بضم الحاء وفتح  السين المهملتين واسكان الياء المثناة من تحت واللام أخيرا، حالف بني عبد الأشهل  فسماه قومهم يمان، لأنه حالف اليمانية، فحذيفة يعد من حلفاء الأنصار.
 وخرج حذيفة هو وأبوه فأخذهما كفار قريش فقالوا: إنكما تريد ان محمدا  فقالا: ما نريد الا المدينة، فأخذوا منهما عهد الله ان لا يقاتلا مع النبي صلى الله عليه وآله وأن ينصرفا  إلى المدينة.
 فأتيا النبي صلى الله عليه وآله فأخبراه وقالا: ان شئت قاتلنا معك قال: بل نفي ونستعين الله  عليهم ففاتتهما بدر، وشهد حذيفة أحدا وما بعدها، ومات بعد قتل عثمان بأيام يسيرة  بعد أن بايع أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام وهو بالكوفة وعلي عليه السلام بالمدينة وقد بويع له.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: لم يكن حذيفة مثل ابن مسعود  لان حذيفة كان ركنا بضم الراء واسكان الكاف قبل النون، أي كان ركنا من

Hudhayfah and Abdullah ibn Mas'ud 78 - He was asked about Ibn Mas'ud and Hudhayfah? He said: Hudhayfah was not like Ibn Mas'ud
 son of Umm Abd, and I disliked for her what Ibn Umm Abd disliked for her (1).
He was of slight build, short, and intensely dark-skinned, almost as tall as a seated tall man (2). He held the position of judge in Kufa and managed its treasury for Umar and for a period during the caliphate of Uthman, then he went to Medina and died there in the year thirty-two. He was buried in al-Baqi', and he was in his sixties.
Hudhayfah ibn Yaman, Abu Abdullah al-Absi, was one of the great Companions and one of the four pillars of steadfastness with Ali, peace be upon him, after the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, according to one account. We have already provided his biography and what should be mentioned about him (3).
Al-Yaman's name was Husayl ibn Jabir ibn Rabi'ah al-Absi. Husayl, with a *ḍamma* on the Ḥa, a *fatḥa* on the unpointed Sīn, a *sukūn* on the Ya with two dots below, and a Lām at the end. He allied with the Banu Abd al-Ashhal, so their people called him Yaman because he allied with the Yemenites. Thus, Hudhayfah is counted among the allies of the Ansar.
Hudhayfah and his father went out, and the disbelievers of Quraysh captured them and said, "You want Muhammad." They said, "We only want Medina." So they took a covenant from them in the name of God that they would not fight with the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and that they would return to Medina.
They came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and told him. They said, "If you wish, we will fight with you." He said, "Rather, we will fulfill [our promise] and seek God's help against them." So they missed Badr, and Hudhayfah witnessed Uhud and what followed. He died a few days after the killing of Uthman, after pledging allegiance to the Commander of the Believers, peace be upon him, while he was in Kufa and Ali, peace be upon him, was in Medina, and allegiance had been pledged to him.
His saying, may God have mercy on him: Hudhayfah was not like Ibn Mas'ud because Hudhayfah was a *rukn* with a *ḍamma* on the Rā and a *sukūn* on the Kāf before the Nūn, meaning he was a pillar of

text:
لان حذيفة كان ركنا وابن مسعود خلط ووالى القوم ومال معهم وقال بهم، وقال أيضا:
____________________
 الأركان الأربعة بالاستقامة في موالاة علي بن أبي طالب عليه السلام ومتابعته ومطاوعته إياه بعد  رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله وهذا أحد القولين، وقد نقله الشيخ رحمه الله تعالى في كتاب الرجال (1)  والقول الأشهر أن رابع الأركان عمار بن ياسر مكان حذيفة بن يمان رضي  الله تعالى عنهما.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: وابن مسعود خلط ووالي القوم ومال معهم  وقال بهم  " خلط " بتشديد اللام من التخليط، " ووالي القوم " أي أظهر موالاتهم، " ومال  معهم " أي حاص معهم عن طريق الحق، وحاد عن سواء السبيل، كما حاصوا وحادوا  " وقال بهم " أي أذعن لهم وانقاد في ظاهر الامر.
 وقد ورد الاخبار وصح أن ابن مسعود قد رجع عما وقع منه وتندم وتظاهر  بالتندم عليه.
 ومن ذلك ما رواه الحاكم صاحب المستدرك على الصحيحين وشواهد التنزيل  والحافظ أبو نعيم صاحب حلية الأولياء وابن عبد البر صاحب الاستيعاب وأبو بكر  ابن مردويه وأبو عبد الله بن السراج ورهط غيرهم بأسانيد معتبرة عن عبد الله بن مسعود  قال: قال النبي صلى الله عليه وآله يابن مسعود انه قد نزلت في علي آية " فاتقوا فتنة لا تصيبن الذين  ظلموا منكم خاصة (2) " وأنا مستودعكها ومسم لك خاصة الظلمة، لكن لا أقول واعيا  وعني له مؤديا، من ظلم عليا مجلسي هذا فهو كمن جحد نبوتي ونبوة من كان  قبلي.
 فقال له الراوي: يا أبا عبد الرحمن أسمعت هذا من رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله؟! قال:
 نعم قلت له: وأتيت الظالمين، قال: لا جرم جليت عقوبة عملي وذلك أني
footnote: (1) رجال الشيخ: 37 2) سورة الأنفال: 25

Because Hudhayfa was a pillar, but Ibn Mas'ud mixed (things up), allied with the people (the opposition), leaned towards them, and spoke according to them. He also said:
____________________
The four pillars through steadfastness in allegiance to Ali ibn Abi Talib, peace be upon him, following him, and obeying him after the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him and his family. This is one of the two opinions, and the Sheikh, may God have mercy on him, mentioned it in the book *al-Rijāl* (1). The more well-known opinion is that the fourth of the pillars is Ammar ibn Yasir instead of Hudhayfa ibn Yaman, may God Almighty be pleased with them both.

His saying, may God have mercy on him: "Ibn Mas'ud mixed (things up), allied with the people (the opposition), leaned towards them, and spoke according to them." "Mixed" (khallata) with a shadda on the lam, from *takhlīt* (mixing, confusing), "allied with the people" meaning he showed allegiance to them, "leaned towards them" meaning he deviated with them from the path of truth, and strayed from the right way, as they deviated and strayed. "And spoke according to them" meaning he submitted to them and obeyed in outward appearance.

It has been reported in narrations, and verified, that Ibn Mas'ud retracted what he had done, regretted it, and displayed regret for it.

Among that is what al-Hakim, the author of *al-Mustadrak ala al-Sahihayn wa Shawahid al-Tanzil*, al-Hafiz Abu Nu'aym, the author of *Hilyat al-Awliya*, Ibn Abd al-Barr, the author of *al-Isti'ab*, Abu Bakr Ibn Mardawayh, Abu Abdullah Ibn al-Sarraj, and others narrated with reliable isnād (chains of narration) from Abdullah Ibn Mas'ud who said: The Prophet, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him and his family, said: O Ibn Mas'ud, a verse has been revealed about Ali: "And fear a trial which will not strike those who have wronged among you exclusively" (2) and I am entrusting it to you and naming for you those who are especially unjust. But I am not saying it carelessly, and it is meant for you to deliver it. Whoever wrongs Ali in this gathering is like one who denies my prophethood and the prophethood of those who came before me.

 لم استأذن امامي كما استأذنه جندب وعمار وسلمان وأنا أستغفر الله وأتوب إليه (1).
 ولهذا الحديث طرق متظافرة عن غير ابن مسعود من طريق ابن عباس ومن  طريق عمار بن ياسر ومن طريق أبي ذر ومن عداهم من كبار الصحابة رضي الله تعالى  عنهم، قد أوردناها ونقلناها عن العامة والخاصة في كتاب شرح التقدمة.
 و" أتيت " من المواتاة بمعنى المجازات والمماشاة والمساعفة والمساعدة.
 و" جليت بضم الجيم وتشديد اللام المكسورة على البناء للمفعول، وأصله  جللت بلامين مشددة مكسورة وأخرى بعدها ساكنة فاجتمعت ثلاث لامات فقلبت  الأخيرة منها ياء، كما في التظني والتقضي ومشاكلتهما.
 و" عقوبة عملي " منصوبة على أنها منزوعة الخافض.
 والمعني: غطيت بعقوبة عملي فشملتني وعمتني عقوبة ذلك، كما يشمل  الثوب البدن ويغطيه ويعمه.
 قال في أساس البلاغة: وجلله غطاه، وتجلل بثوبه تغطي به، ومن المجاز  تجلله الهم والمرض (2).
 وفي الصحاح: وجلل الشئ تجليلا أي عم، والمجلل السحاب الذي يجلل  الأرض بالمطر أي يعم، وتجليل الفرس أن تلبسه الجل، وتجلله أي علاه، وتجلله  أي أخذ جلاله (3).

I did not seek permission from my Imam as Jundab, Ammar, and Salman sought permission from him, and I seek forgiveness from Allah and repent to Him (1).
This hadith has corroborating chains of transmission from sources other than Ibn Mas'ud, through the route of Ibn Abbas, Ammar ibn Yasir, Abu Dharr, and others among the prominent Companions, may Allah Almighty be pleased with them. We have included them and transmitted them from both Sunni and Shia sources in the book *Sharh al-Taqdima*.
"Ataytu" (أتيت) from *al-muwatat* means allowances, going along with, accommodating, and assisting.
"Julilt" (جليت) with a *damma* on the *jim* and a *shadda* on the *lam* with a *kasra*, in the passive form. Its origin is *jullilt* (جللت) with two *lams* with a *shadda* and a *kasra*, followed by another *lam* with a *sukun*. Three *lams* gathered, so the last one was changed to a *ya’*, as in *al-taẓannī* and *al-taqaḍḍī* and similar words.
"ʿUqūbatu ʿamalī" (عقوبة عملي) - "the penalty of my deeds" - is in the accusative case because the preposition has been removed.
The meaning is: I was covered by the penalty of my deeds, so the penalty of that covered me and encompassed me, as a garment covers the body and encompasses it.
In *Asās al-Balāgha*, he said: *wa jallalahu* means he covered it, and *tajallala bi thawbihi* means he covered himself with his garment. Metaphorically, *tajallalahu al-hammu wal-maraḍ* (grief and sickness covered him) (2).
In *al-Ṣiḥāḥ*: *wa jallal al-shay’ tajlīlan* means it encompassed it. *Al-mujlil* is the cloud that covers the earth with rain, meaning it encompasses it. *Tajlīl al-faras* is to dress the horse with a *jill* (horse cloth), *wa tajallalahu* means it rose above it, and *tajallalahu* means he took its *jilal* (3).

 السابقون الذين رجعوا إلى أمير المؤمنين (عليه السلام)  ذكر منهم خمسة عشر رجلا بأسمائهم.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: أبو الهيثم بن التيهان بالهاء المفتوحة والمثناة من تحت الساكنة ثم المثلثة المفتوحة قبل الميم، اسمه  في المشهور مالك بن تيهان بالمثناة من فوق قبل المثناة من تحت المشددة المفتوحتين  وقيل: بكسر الياء المشددة البلوي، من أصحاب أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام وخواصه من  الصحابة، ذكره الشيخ في كتاب الرجال (1)، والعلامة في الخلاصة (2). والأصح أنه  من شهداء أصحابه عليه السلام بصفين.
 قال في المغرب: علي كرم الله وجهه قال لابن عباس: انك رجل تايه: أما  علمت أن النبي صلى الله عليه وآله حرم لحوم الحمر. التيه: التحير والذهاب عن الطريق القصد،  يقال: تاه في المفازة، وانما خاطبه بهذا حيث اعتقد أنه استحل ما حرم رسول الله،  فجعله كالتارك للقصد والمايل عنه.
 و" تيهان " فيعلان - بالفتح من تاه، وبه سمي والد أبي الهيثم مالك بن تيهان  وهو من الصحابة.
 وقال ابن الأثير في جامع الأصول: أبو الهيثم مالك بن التيهان بن مالك،  وقيل: اسم التيهان مالك بن عمرو بن زيد، وفي نسبه خلاف فمنهم من يجعله أنصاريا  من الأوس، ومنهم من يجعله بلويا من بلي بن الحاف بن فضاعة، ويقال: انه حليف  بني عبد الأشهل، شهد العقبة الأولى والثانية مع السبعين، وكان أحد الستة الذين لقوا  رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله قبل ذلك بالعقبة فيما زعم بنو عبد الأشهل، وهو أحد النقباء الاثنا  عشر، وشهد بدرا وأحدا والمشاهد كلها، روي عنه أبو هريرة، وقيل: مات في

Among the forerunners who returned to the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, was Abu al-Haytham ibn al-Tayhan.____________________
The forerunners who returned to the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him) included fifteen men mentioned by their names.
The statement of may God have mercy on him: Abu al-Haytham ibn al-Tayhan, with a ﻫ with a fatḥah, and a ى with two dots underneath that is silent, then a ث with three dots and a fatḥah before the م. His name, in the well-known version, is Malik ibn Tayhan, with a ﺕ with two dots above before the ى with two dots underneath, with a shaddah and a fatḥah. It is also said: with a kasrah on the ي with a shaddah, al-Balawi, from the companions of the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, and his close associates from the Companions. Al-Shaykh mentioned him in the book of Rijāl (1), and al-'Allamah in al-Khulasah (2). The more correct view is that he was one of the martyrs among his companions, peace be upon him, at Ṣiffīn.
It is said in al-Maghrib: Ali, may God honor his face, said to Ibn Abbas: "You are a tā’ih (lost) man. Did you not know that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, forbade the meat of donkeys?" Al-tih (lostness) is bewilderment and straying from the intended path. It is said: Tāha (he was lost) in the desert. He addressed him in this way because he believed that he had deemed lawful what the Messenger of God had forbidden, so he considered him like one who abandons the purpose and deviates from it.
And "Tayhan" is fayʿalān - with a fatḥah from tāha (lost), and that's what Abu al-Haytham's father, Malik ibn Tayhan, was named, and he is one of the Companions.
Ibn al-Athir said in Jami al-Usul: Abu al-Haytham Malik ibn al-Tayhan ibn Malik, and it is said: the name of al-Tayhan is Malik ibn Amr ibn Zayd, and there is disagreement in his lineage. text:
وأبو سعيد الخدري وسهل بن حنيف والبراء بن مالك ____________________
 رجعنا إلى المدينة ليخرجن الأعز منها الأذل " (1) قال ذلك وعنى بالأعز نفسه، فسمع  بذلك زيد بن أرقم وهو حدث فقال: أنت والله الذليل القليل المبغض في قومه،  ومحمد في عزة من الرحمن وقوة من المسلمين فقال عبد الله: أسكت فإنما كنت ألعب،  فأخبر زيد رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله.
 وقال الذهبي في مختصره: زيد بن أرقم الخزرجي بالكوفة، عن أسبع عشرة  مرة، عن طاوس وأبو إسحاق، وكان من خواص علي، توفي 68، وقيل 66.
 وليعلم أن والد زيد بن أرقم هو أرقم بن زيد بن قيس الأنصاري، وفي كنية  زيد بن أرقم أقوال أربعة: أبو عمر وأبو عامر وأبو أنية (2)، وأما الذي كان النبي صلى الله عليه وآله  يسكن داره بمكة صدر الاسلام فهو الأرقم بن أبي الأرقم، واسم أبي الأرقم عبد  مناف بن أسد بن عبد الله عمر بن مخزوم: كانت داره على الصفا بمكة وهي التي دخلها  النبي صلى الله عليه وآله، أول زمان النبوة وكان يكون فيها، ففيها دعى الناس إلى دين الاسلام  وفيها أسلم خلق كثير، وشهد الأرقم بن أبي الأرقم بدرا واحدا والمشاهد كلها مع  النبي صلى الله عليه وسلم ومات سنة خمس وخمسين بالمدينة، وهو ابن بضع وثمانين سنة.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: وأبو سعيد الخدري، وسهل بن حنيف  قد تقدمت ترجمة سهل بن حنيف، وأبو سعيد الخدري سيجئ ما في معناه في  ترجمته.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: والبراء بن مالك  قال الشيخ رحمة الله في كتاب الرجال في باب من روى عن النبي صلى الله عليه وآله من  الصحابة: البراء بن مالك الأنصاري أخو أنس بن مالك، شهد أحدا والخندق، وقتل  يوم تستر (3).

And Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, Sahl bin Hanif, and al-Bara' bin Malik...
Returned to Medina [saying], "Indeed, the more honored [there] will expel therefrom the less honored." (1) He said that, meaning himself by "the more honored." Zayd bin Arqam, who was a young man at the time, heard that and said: "You, by Allah, are the lowly, the few, the hated among his people, while Muhammad is in might from the Most Merciful and power from the Muslims." Abdullah said: "Be quiet, I was only joking." Zayd informed the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family.
Al-Dhahabi said in his Mukhtaṣar: "Zayd bin Arqam al-Khazraji, in Kufa, from seventeen times, from Tawus and Abu Ishaq. He was among the close associates of Ali. He died in 68 AH, or it was said, 66 AH."
It should be known that the father of Zayd bin Arqam is Arqam bin Zayd bin Qays al-Ansari. There are four opinions regarding the kunya (nickname) of Zayd bin Arqam: Abu 'Umar, Abu 'Amir, and Abu Aniyya (2). As for the one whose house the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, resided in Mecca at the beginning of Islam, he is al-Arqam bin Abi al-Arqam, and the name of Abi al-Arqam is Abd Manaf bin Asad bin Abdullah Umar bin Makhzum. His house was on al-Safa in Mecca, and it was the one that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, entered at the beginning of the time of prophethood and used to be in it. In it, people were called to the religion of Islam, and in it, many people embraced Islam. Al-Arqam bin Abi al-Arqam witnessed Badr, Uhud, and all the battles with the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and died in the year fifty-five in Medina, at the age of eighty-odd years.
His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: "And Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, and Sahl bin Hanif..." The biography of Sahl bin Hanif has already been mentioned, and Abu Sa'id al-Khudri will be mentioned in his biography.
His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: "And al-Bara' bin Malik..."

text:
وعثمان بن حنيف ____________________
 وفي جامع الأصول وغيره: البراء بن مالك بن النضر بن ضمضم أخو أنس  لأبيه وأمه، وشهد أحدا وما بعدها مع النبي (ص) وكان شجاعا، روى أنس بن مالك  عن النبي صلى الله عليه وآله أنه قال: رب ذي طمرين لا يؤبه له لو أقسم على الله للأبره، منهم  البراء بن مالك (1). فلما كان يوم تستر انكشف الناس فقالوا: يا براء أقسم على ربك  فقال: أقسم عليك أي رب لما منحتنا أكتافهم وألحقتني بنبيك فاستشهد.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: وعثمان بن حنيف  هو أخو سهل بن حنيف، عثمان بن حنيف بن واهب أبو عبد الله الأنصاري  ذكره الشيخ رحمه الله في كتاب الرجال في أصحاب أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام قال:
 عثمان ابن حنيف الأنصاري عربي (2).
 وذكر المسعودي في مروج الذهب مسير عثمان بن حنيف الأنصاري إلى  البصرة على خراجها من قبل علي عليه السلام قال: وسار القوم نحو البصرة في ست مائة  راكب، فانتهوا في الليل إلي ماء لبني كلاب يعرف بالحوأب عليه أناس من بني  كلاب، فعوت كلابهم على الركب، فقالت عائشة: ما اسم هذا الموضع؟ فقال  لها السائق لجملها: الحوأب فاسترجعت وذكرت ما قيل لها في ذلك وقالت: ردوني  إلى حرم رسول الله لا حاجة لي في المسير.
 فقال الزبير: بالله ما هذا الحوأب ولقد غلط فيما أخبرك به، وكان طلحة في ساقة الناس فحلقها فاقسم أن ذلك ليس بالحوأب، وشهد معهما خمسون ممن كان  معهم فكان ذلك أول شهادة زور أقيمت في الاسلام، فأتوا البصرة فخرج إليهم عثمان  ابن حنيف فما نعم وجرى بينهم قتال إلى آخر ما ذكره (3).
footnote: (1) جامع الأصول: - 10 / 61 2) رجال الشيخ: 47 3) مروج الذهب: 2 / 357 - 358

T Text:

And Uthman ibn Hunaif ____________________
In Jami' al-Usul and other sources: Al-Bara' ibn Malik ibn al-Nadr ibn Damdam, the brother of Anas from his father and mother, witnessed Uhud and subsequent battles with the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him). He was courageous. Anas ibn Malik narrated that the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "There are those with tattered garments who are not given importance, but if they were to swear by Allah, He would fulfill their oath. Among them is Al-Bara' ibn Malik (1)." When the day of Tastar came, the people were exposed, so they said: "O Bara', swear by your Lord!" So he said: "I adjure You, O Lord, to grant us their shoulders and join me with Your Prophet," and he was martyred.

His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: And Uthman ibn Hunaif, he is the brother of Sahl ibn Hunaif. Uthman ibn Hunaif ibn Wahb, Abu Abdullah al-Ansari, whom al-Sheikh (may Allah have mercy on him) mentioned in the book of *al-Rijāl* regarding the companions of Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him), said:
Uthman ibn Hunaif al-Ansari is an Arab (2).

Al-Mas'udi mentioned in *Muruj al-Dhahab* the journey of Uthman ibn Hunaif al-Ansari to Basra to collect its taxes on behalf of Ali (peace be upon him), saying: The people set out towards Basra with six hundred riders, and they arrived at night at a watering place belonging to Bani Kilab known as al-Haw'ab, inhabited by people from Bani Kilab. Their dogs barked at the riders, so Aisha said: "What is the name of this place?" The driver of her camel said to her: "Al-Haw'ab." So she said "Inna lillahi wa inna ilayhi raji'un" and recalled what had been said to her about it, and said: "Return me to the sanctuary of the Messenger of Allah, I have no need for this journey."

Al-Zubayr said: "By Allah, this is not al-Haw'ab, and he has erred in what he told you." Talha was at the rear of the people, so he caught up with her and swore that this was not al-Haw'ab. Fifty of those who were with them testified with them, and that was the first false testimony established in Islam. So they came to Basra, and Uthman ibn Hunaif came out to them, and no quarter was given and fighting took place between them until the end of what he mentioned (3).

text:
وعبادة بن الصامت، ثم ممن دونهم قيس بن سعد بن عبادة ____________________
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: وعبادة بن الصامت  ممن أسلم قديما وثبت في الايمان مستقيما، وهو السبب في اسلام كعب بن  عجرة، وقد كانت بينهما صداقة.
 ذكره الشيخ رحمه الله تعالى في كتاب الرجال فيمن روى عن النبي صلى الله عليه وآله  من الصحابة (1).
 ثم ذكره في أصحاب أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام قال: عبادة بن الصامت ابن أخي  أبي ذر ممن أقام بالبصرة وكان شيعيا (2).
 وفي جامع الأصول: عبادة بضم العين وتخفيف الباء الموحدة. وقال  الدارقطني وأبو بكر البرقي وغيرهما من العامة: عبادة بن الصامت بن قيس بن أصرم  ابن فهر بن ثعلبة، يكنى أبا الوليد شهد العقبة مع السبعين، وهو أحد النقباء الاثنا عشر،  وشهد بدرا وأحدا والمشاهد كلها مع النبي صلى الله عليه وآله، وكان يعلم أهل الصفة القرآن،  وله من الولد الوليد ومحمد، ومات بالرملة من أرض الشام، وقيل: بيت المقدس  سنة أربع وثلاثين، وهو ابن اثنتين وسبعين، وقيل: بقي حتى توفي في خلافة  معاوية (3).
 قوله رحمه الله: قيس بن سعد بن عبادة  قد أسلفنا ذكره في حديث المتحورين من السابقين، وهم الذين رجعوا إلى  أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام وأبوا أن يبايعوا فلانا وفلانا، وسيعاد ما في معناه مبسوطا في ترجمته
footnote: (1) رجال الشيخ: 23 2) رجال الشيخ: 47 3) مخطوط لم أظفر عليه
translation:
T Text:
---
And 'Ubada ibn al-Samit, then those after them, Qays ibn Sa'd ibn 'Ubada ____________________
His statement, may Allah have mercy on him: And 'Ubada ibn al-Samit, is among those who embraced Islam early and remained steadfast in faith, and he was the reason for the conversion of Ka'b ibn 'Ujra, as there was friendship between them.
The Sheikh, may Allah have mercy on him, mentioned him in the book of *Rijal* among those who narrated from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, from the Companions (1).
Then he mentioned him among the companions of Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, saying: 'Ubada ibn al-Samit, the nephew of Abu Dharr, was among those who resided in Basra and was a Shi'a (2).
And in *Jami' al-Usul*: 'Ubada, with a damma on the 'ayn and a light ba' muwahhada. Al-Daraqutni, Abu Bakr al-Barqi, and others from the common people said: 'Ubada ibn al-Samit ibn Qays ibn Asram ibn Fahr ibn Tha'laba, known as Abu al-Walid, witnessed the Pledge of Aqaba with the seventy, and he was one of the twelve leaders, and he witnessed Badr, Uhud, and all the battles with the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family, and he used to teach the people of the Suffa the Quran, and he had children named al-Walid and Muhammad, and he died in al-Ramla in the land of Sham, and it was said: in Jerusalem, in the year thirty-four, and he was seventy-two years old, and it was said: he remained until he died during the caliphate of Mu'awiya (3).
His statement, may Allah have mercy on him: Qays ibn Sa'd ibn 'Ubada. We have already mentioned him in the hadith of the *mutahawwirin* from the *sabiqin*, who returned to Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, and refused to pledge allegiance to so-and-so and so-and-so, and what is meant by that will be repeated in detail in his biography.

text:
وعدي بن حاتم وعمرو بن الحمق وعمران بن الحصين ____________________
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: عدى بن حاتم  عدي بالمهملتين المفتوحة ثم المكسورة قبل الياء المشددة ابن حاتم بن  عبد الله أبو طريف الطائي.
 ذكره الشيخ في كتاب الرجال في الصحابة، وفي أصحاب أمير المؤمنين  عليه السلام (1).
 وفي مختصر الذهبي: عدي بن حاتم عبد الله بن سعد الطائي الجواد بن  الجواد، أسلم سنة سبع، عنه الشعبي وأبو إسحاق وسعيد بن جبير، نزل قرقيسا منعزلا  قال ابن سعد: مات 68 عن مأة وعشرين سنة.
 قوله رحمه الله: وعمرو بن الحمق  سيورد أمره في ترجمته من ذي قبل.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: وعمران بن الحصين  هو أبو نجيد بضم النون وفتح الجيم على التصغير، عمران بن الحصين -  باهمال الصاد المفتوحة بعد الحاء المهملة المضمومة - ابن عبيد بن خلب بن عبد نهم -  بفتح النون واسكان الهاء - الخزاعي الأزدي.
 ذكره الشيخ رحمه الله في الصحابة (2).
 قال أكثر علماء الحديث والرجال من العامة، أسلم قديما، وغزا مع النبي  صلى الله عليه وآله غزوات، ولم يزل في بلاد قومه، ثم تحول إلى البصرة إلى أن مات بها في  خلافة معاوية، وكان به مرض، فكانت الملائكة تسلم عليه فلما اكتوى انقطع التسليم  ثم عاد إليه.
 وقال الذهبي: منهم عمار بن حصين الخزاعي أبي نجيد أسلم مع أبي هريرة،  وكانت الملائكة تسلم عليه مات 52.
footnote: (1) رجال الشيخ: 23 و 49 2) رجال الشيخ: 32

Waʿdī ibn Ḥātim, ʿAmr ibn al-Ḥamq, and ʿImrān ibn al-Ḥuṣayn.
His statement, may Allah have mercy on him: ʿAdī ibn Ḥātim - ʿAdī, with two unpointed letters (ʿayn and dāl) with a fatha, then a kasra before the doubled yāʾ, ibn Ḥātim ibn ʿAbd Allāh, Abū Ṭarīf al-Ṭāʾī.
Al-Shaykh mentioned him in the book of Rijāl (Biographical Evaluation) among the Companions, and among the Companions of Amīr al-Muʾminīn (peace be upon him) (1).
In al-Dhahabī's Mukhtaṣar (Abridgement): ʿAdī ibn Ḥātim ʿAbd Allāh ibn Saʿd al-Ṭāʾī, the generous son of the generous. He embraced Islam in the year seven. Al-Shaʿbī, Abū Isḥāq, and Saʿīd ibn Jubayr narrated from him. He settled in Qirqīsiyā, secluded. Ibn Saʿd said: He died in 68 AH at the age of one hundred and twenty years.
His statement, may Allah have mercy on him: ʿAmr ibn al-Ḥamq - his affair will be mentioned in his biography shortly.
His statement, may Allah have mercy on him: ʿImrān ibn al-Ḥuṣayn - he is Abū Nujayd (with a ḍamma on the nūn and a fatha on the jīm, diminutive form), ʿImrān ibn al-Ḥuṣayn (with an unpointed ṣād with a fatha after the ḥāʾ with a ḍamma) ibn ʿUbayd ibn Khalab ibn ʿAbd Nahm (with a fatha on the nūn and a sukūn on the hāʾ) al-Khuzāʿī al-Azdī.
Al-Shaykh, may Allah have mercy on him, mentioned him among the Companions (2).
Most scholars of ḥadīth and rijāl (biographical evaluation) from the general populace (Sunnis) said: He embraced Islam early and participated in battles with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family). He remained in the land of his people, then moved to Basra until he died there during the caliphate of Muʿāwiya. He had an illness, and the angels used to greet him. When he cauterized himself, the greeting ceased, then returned to him.
Al-Dhahabī said: Among them is ʿAmmār ibn Ḥuṣayn al-Khuzāʿī Abū Nujayd. He embraced Islam with Abū Hurayra, and the angels used to greet him. He died in 52 AH.

text:
وبريدة الأسلمي ____________________
 وفي جامع الأصول: أسلم هو وأبوه عام خيبر، وسكن البصرة إلى أن مات  بها سنة اثنتين وخمسين، وقيل: سنة ثلاث، وكان من فضلاء الصحابة وفقهائهم،  وسئل عمران بن الحصين عن متعة النساء فقال: أتانا بها كتاب الله وأمرنا بها رسول  الله صلى الله عليه وآله ثم قال فيها رجل برأيه ما شاء فلا يتبع قوله، ولو لم ينه عنه مازني الا شقي.
 يعني به عمر بن الخطاب ونهيه عنها برأيه في مقابلة نص الكتاب والسنة.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: وبريدة الأسلمي  هو أخو أبي داود لامه، وقد سبق في ترجمته أبي داود في حديث أبي داود في  حديث عمران بن حصين الخزاعي أن رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله أمر فلانا وفلانا أن يسلما على  علي عليه السلام بأمرة المؤمنين. وهو أبو عبد الله الأسلمي بريدة - بضم الموحدة وفتح الراء  واسكان المثناة من تحت ثم الدال المهملة والهاء أخيرا - ابن الحصيب - بضم الحاء  وفتح الصاد المهملتين على التصغير - ابن عبد الله بن الحارث.
 وفي القاصرين من يصحف غالطا فيعجم الخاء ويفتحها ويكسر الصاد المهملة  بعدها.
 قال في القاموس في ح ص ب: بريدة بن الحصيب كزبير صحابي ومحمد بن  الحصيب حفيده (1).
 وفي المغرب: البردة بالهاء كساء مربع أسود صغير وبها كني أبو بردة بن نيار  صاحب الجذعة واسمه هاني، وبتصغيرها سمي بريدة بن الحصيب وابنه سليمان بن  بريدة، يروي عن أبيه وعنه علقمة.
 والشيخ رحمه الله في كتاب الرجال ذكره في عدد الصحابة قال: بريدة بن  الحصيب الأسلمي، وقيل: أبو الحصيب (2)، ثم ذكره في أصحاب أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام
footnote: (1) القاموس: 1 / 55 2) رجال الشيخ: 10 وفيه الخصيب بالخاء المعجمة

T Text:

And Buraydah al-Aslami ____________________
In Jami' al-Usul: Aslam and his father embraced Islam in the year of Khaybar and resided in Basra until his death there in the year fifty-two, and it was said: the year fifty-three. He was among the virtuous and knowledgeable Companions. Imran bin Husayn was asked about temporary marriage (Mut'at al-Nisa), and he said: "The Book of Allah brought it to us, and the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, commanded us to do it. Then a man said whatever he wished based on his own opinion, so his saying is not to be followed. Had he not forbidden it, only the wretched would abstain."
He meant Umar ibn al-Khattab and his prohibition of it based on his own opinion in opposition to the text of the Book and the Sunnah.
His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: Buraydah al-Aslami is the brother of Abu Dawud from his mother's side. It has already been mentioned in the biography of Abu Dawud in the hadith of Abu Dawud in the hadith of Imran bin Husayn al-Khuza'i that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, commanded so-and-so and so-and-so to greet Ali, peace be upon him, with the title "Ameer al-Mu'minin" (Commander of the Believers). He is Abu Abdullah al-Aslami, Buraydah - with a ḍamma on the ba, a fatḥa on the ra, a sukun on the tha' (two dots below), then a dal muhmala, and a ha at the end - ibn al-Husayb - with a ḍamma on the ḥa, and a fatḥa on the ṣad muhmala on the diminutive form - ibn Abdullah ibn al-Harith.
And among those who are deficient, there are those who err by putting a dot on the kha and giving it a fatḥa and kasra on the ṣad muhmala after it.
It is stated in al-Qamus in ḥ ṣ b: Buraydah bin al-Husayb, like Zubayr, is a companion, and Muhammad bin al-Husayb is his grandson (1).
And in al-Maghrib: al-Burda with a ha is a small square black cloak, and Abu Burda bin Niyar, the owner of the young goat, was named after it, and his name is Hani, and with its diminutive form, Buraydah bin al-Husayb and his son Sulayman bin Buraydah were named. He narrates from his father and from him, 'Alqama.
And the Sheikh, may Allah have mercy on him, in the book of Rijal mentioned him in the number of the companions, saying: Buraydah bin al-Husayb al-Aslami, and it was said: Abu al-Husayb (2), then he mentioned him among the companions of Ameer al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him.

text:
____________________
 بلال رضى الله تعالى عنه وصهيب موليان  بلال بن رباح بالموحدة بعد الراء المفتوحة والمهملة بعد الألف، واسم امه  حمامة مولاة بني جمح، وكان يعذبه قومه ويذكرون اللات والعزى، وهو يذكر الله  سبحانه ويقول: أحد أحد، شهد مع النبي صلى الله عليه وآله بدرا وأحدا والمشاهد كلها، وهو  أول من أذن لرسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله، وكان يؤذن له حضرا وسفرا، وكان خازنه على بيت  ماله، وهو سابق الحبشة، فلما توفى رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله لم يؤذن لاحد، خرج من المدينة  فذهب إلى الشام، ومات بدمشق وقيل: مات بحلب سنة عشرين وقيل: ثماني  عشرة، ودفن هنالك، وكان نحيفا طوالا شديد الأدمة.
 ذكره الشيخ في الصحابة وقال: بلال مولى رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله شهد بدرا، وتوفى  بدمشق في الطاعون، سنة ثماني عشرة، كنيته أبو عبد الله، وقيل: أبو عمرو، ويقال:
 أبو عبد الكريم. وهو بلال بن رياح مدفون بباب الصغير بدمشق (1).
 " صهيب " يكنى أبا يحيى، وهو ابن سنان بن مالك بن عبد عمرو النميري،  بفتحتين نسبة إلى نمر بن قاسط، بكسر الميم بعد النون المفتوحة، سبي وهو غلام  صغير كانت منازلهم بأرض الموصل فيما بين دجلة والفرات وأغارت الروم على تلك  الناحية فسبته صغيرا فنشأ بالروم، فأبتا عته منهم كلب ثم قدمت به مكة فاشتراه  عبد الله بن جدعان التيمي فاعتقه.
 ويقال: انه لما كبر في الروم وعقل وهرب منهم وقدم مكة، فحالف عبد الله بن  جدعان، بضم الجيم واسكان الدال المهملة واهمال العين، فأقام معه إلى أن هلك  وبعث النبي صلى الله عليه وآله، فأسلم قديما بمكة.
 قال في جامع الأصول يقال: إنه أسلم هو عمار بن ياسر في يوم واحد ورسول الله  صلى الله عليه وآله بدار الأرقم بعد بضعة وثلاثين رجلا، وكان من المستضعفين المعذبين في الله
footnote: (1) رجال الشيخ: 8
translation:
T Text:
---
Bilal, may Allah be pleased with him, and Suhayb were both freed slaves. Bilal ibn Rabah, with a muwahhada ( ب ) after the ra ( ر ) with a fatha ( َ ) and a silent ha ( ه ) after the alif ( ا ). His mother's name was Humama, a freed slave of Banu Jumah. His people used to torture him, mentioning Al-Lat and Al-Uzza, but he would mention Allah, the Most Glorified, the Most High, and say, "Ahad, Ahad (One, One)." He witnessed Badr, Uhud, and all the battles with the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family. He was the first to call the adhan (call to prayer) for the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and his family, and he would call it whether the Prophet was residing or traveling. He was the treasurer of the Prophet's treasury. He was the first Abyssinian to embrace Islam. When the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and his family, passed away, he did not call the adhan for anyone. He left Medina and went to Syria, and died in Damascus. It is also said that he died in Aleppo in the year twenty, or it is said eighteen, and he was buried there. He was thin, tall, and very dark-skinned.
The Sheikh mentioned him among the Companions and said: Bilal, the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and his family, witnessed Badr and died in Damascus during the plague in the year eighteen. His kunya (nickname) was Abu Abdullah, and it is said Abu Amr, and it is also said Abu Abd al-Karim. He is Bilal ibn Riyah, buried at Bab al-Saghir in Damascus (1).
"Suhayb" His kunya (nickname) is Abu Yahya, and he is the son of Sinan ibn Malik ibn Abd Amr al-Numairi, with two fathas ( َ َ ), in reference to Nimr ibn Qasit, with a kasra ( ِ ) on the mim ( م ) after the nun ( ن ) with a fatha ( َ ). He was captured as a young boy; their homes were in the land of Mosul, between the Tigris and Euphrates. The Romans raided that area and captured him when he was young, so he grew up in Rome. Kalb bought him from them, then brought him to Mecca, and Abdullah ibn Judan al-Timi bought him and freed him.
It is said that when he grew up in Rome and became intelligent, he fled from them and came to Mecca, and allied himself with Abdullah ibn Judan, with a damma ( ُ ) on the jim ( ج ) and a sukun ( ْ ) on the dal ( د ) and a silent ain ( ع ). He stayed with him until he died and the Prophet, may Allah bless him and his family, was sent, and he embraced Islam early in Mecca.
It is said in Jami al-Usul that he and Ammar ibn Yasir embraced Islam on the same day, and the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and his family, was in Dar al-Arqam after thirty-some men, and he was one of the oppressed who were tortured for the sake of Allah.

text:
بلال وصهيب موليان 79 - أبو عبد الله محمد بن إبراهيم، قال حدثني علي بن محمد بن يزيد القمي، ____________________
 ثم هاجر إلى المدينة بعد هجرة النبي، صلى الله عليه وآله شهد بدرا والمشاهد كلها: وهو سابق  الروم. مات بالمدينة سنة ثمان وثلاثين عن سبعين سنة، وقيل: سنة تسع وثلاثين وهو  ابن ثلاث وسبعين سنة ودفن بالبقيع.
 ذكره الشيخ رحمه الله تعالى في كتاب الرجال في عداد الصحابة (1)، ولم  يزد على مجرد ذكره بقوله: صهيب بن سنان شيئا.
 والحسن بن داود أورده في كتابه قسم الضعفاء وقال: صهيب مولى رسول  الله صلى الله عليه وآله (2).
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: أبو عبد الله محمد بن إبراهيم  هو محمد بن إبراهيم الوراق من أهل سمرقند، ذكره الشيخ رحمه الله في  باب لم (3).
 فأما محمد بن إبراهيم بن يوسف الكاتب الذي كان يتفقه على مذهب الشافعي  ظاهرا، ويري رأي الشيعة في الباطن، وكان ففيها على المذهبين، وله في المذهبين  كتب: فهو وإن كان في هذه الطبقة يروي عنه ابن عبدون، الا أنه ليس هذا الذي  روى عنه أبو عمرو الكشي رحمه الله، وكنيته أبو الحسن ويعرف بأبي بكر الشافعي،  لا أبو عبد الله.
 قوله رحمه الله: علي بن محمد بن يزيد القمي  في بعض النسخ " بريدة " مكان يزيد
footnote: (١) رجال الشيخ: ٢١ ٢) رجال ابن داود: ٤٦٢ 3) رجال الشيخ: 497

Bilal and Suhaib, freed slaves. 79 - Abu Abdullah Muhammad bin Ibrahim said: Ali bin Muhammad bin Yazid al-Qummi narrated to me, ____________________
Then he migrated to Medina after the Prophet's migration, peace and blessings be upon him and his family. He witnessed Badr and all the battles: and he was the first of the Romans. He died in Medina in the year thirty-eight at the age of seventy, and it was said: in the year thirty-nine, and he was seventy-three years old, and he was buried in al-Baqi'.
Shaykh, may God have mercy on him, mentioned him in the book of *Rijal* in the list of the Companions (1), and did not add anything to merely mentioning him by saying: Suhaib bin Sinan, anything.
Al-Hasan bin Dawood mentioned him in his book *Qism al-Ḍu‘afā’* (Section on the Weak) and said: Suhaib was a freed slave of the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him and his family (2).
His statement, may God have mercy on him: Abu Abdullah Muhammad bin Ibrahim, is Muhammad bin Ibrahim al-Warraq from the people of Samarkand. Shaykh, may God have mercy on him, mentioned him in the chapter Lam (3).
As for Muhammad bin Ibrahim bin Yusuf al-Katib, who used to study jurisprudence according to the Shafi'i school of thought outwardly, and held the views of the Shi'a inwardly, and he was on both schools of thought, and he has books in both schools of thought: he, even though he is in this class, Ibn Abdun narrates from him, but he is not the one from whom Abu Amr al-Kashshi, may God have mercy on him, narrated. His kunya is Abu al-Hasan and he is known as Abu Bakr al-Shafi'i, not Abu Abdullah.
His statement, may God have mercy on him: Ali bin Muhammad bin Yazid al-Qummi
In some versions, "Buraidah" is in place of Yazid.

text:
قال حدثني عبد الله بن محمد بن عيسى، عن ابن أبي عمير، عن هشام بن سالم، عن أبي ____________________
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: عبد الله بن محمد بن عيسى  عبد الله بن محمد هذا هو أخو أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى الأشعري القمي، ولقبه  بنان، كما سيذكره أبو عمرو الكشي رحمه الله في مقامه من ذي قبل، فيورد في  الأسانيد بلقبه فيقال: عن بنان بن محمد.
 وبعض شهداء المتأخرين رفع الله درجته كأنه لم يعثر على ذلك فكثيرا ما في  شرح الشرائع يحكم على الحديث بعدم الصحة، بأن في طريقه بنان بن محمد وهو  مجهول، فنحن في المعلقات على الاستبصار وعلى التهذيب وفي كتاب ضوابط  الرضاع قد نبهنا على فساد قوله وأوضحنا حال الرجل.
 وفي الكافي في بعض أبواب كتاب الصوم، محمد بن يحيى عن بنان بن محمد  عن أخيه عبد الرحمن بن محمد (1).
 وعلى هذا فيكون أحمد وبنان وعبد الرحمن ثلاثة أخوة، وهم أبناء محمد بن  عيسى.
 ومن أعا جيب الأوهام تحامل (2) احتمال الواو مكان " ابن " في قول الشيخ في  الاستبصار في باب الجهر ب‍ " بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم " فأما ما رواه سعد بن عبد الله،  عن أحمد بن محمد، عن محمد بن أبي عمير (3). ونفى البعد عن كون محمد هو محمد  ابن محمد بن عيسى، فيكون أخا أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى.
 فلم يبلغني عن أحد فيما وقع إلي إلى الان أن لمحمد بن عيسى ابنا يقال له:
 محمد، فلا تكونن من المتوهمين.
footnote: (١) الكافي: ٤ / ١٧٤ باب الفطرة ح ٢٢ ٢) تحامله صاحب المنتقى " منه " ٣) الاستبصار: ١ / 312

He said: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Isa narrated to me, from Ibn Abi Umair, from Hisham ibn Salim, from Abi ____________________
His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Isa. This Abdullah ibn Muhammad is the brother of Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa al-Ash'ari al-Qummi, and his nickname is Banan, as Abu Amr al-Kashshi, may Allah have mercy on him, will mention in his station from before. He includes it in the isnads (chains of narration) by his nickname, so it is said: From Banan ibn Muhammad.
Some later martyrs, may Allah elevate his rank, did not seem to come across this, so often in the explanation of al-Shara’i’ he judges the hadith as unsound, stating that Banan ibn Muhammad is in its path and he is majhūl (unknown). We have pointed out the corruption of his saying and clarified the state of the man in the commentaries on al-Istibsar and al-Tahdhib and in the book "Ḍawābiṭ al-Riḍā'".
And in al-Kafi, in some chapters of the Book of Fasting, [it says]: Muhammad ibn Yahya from Banan ibn Muhammad from his brother Abd al-Rahman ibn Muhammad (1).
Thus, Ahmad, Banan, and Abd al-Rahman are three brothers, and they are the sons of Muhammad ibn Isa.
Among the marvels of illusions is the difficulty (2) of taking the "waw" as a possibility instead of "ibn" in the Sheikh's statement in al-Istibsar in the chapter on pronouncing "Bismillah al-Rahman al-Rahim" audibly: As for what Sa'd ibn Abdullah narrated, from Ahmad ibn Muhammad, from Muhammad ibn Abi Umair (3). And he ruled out the possibility that Muhammad is Muhammad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa, making him the brother of Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa.
It has not reached me from anyone, as far as I have come across until now, that Muhammad ibn Isa had a son named Muhammad, so do not be among those who are deluded.

عبد الله عليه السلام قال كان بلال عبدا صالحا وكا ن صهيب عبد سوء كان يبكي على عمر.
أسامة بن زيد 80 - حدثنا محمد بن مسعود، قال حدثني علي بن محمد قال حدثني محمد ____________________
 قوله عليه السلام: وكان بلال عبدا صالحا  وروى الصدوق أبو جعفر ابن بابويه رضوان الله تعالى عليه في الفقيه عن أبي  بصير عن أحدهما عليهما السلام أنه قال: إن بلالا كان عبدا صالحا فقال: لا أؤذن لاحد بعد رسول  الله صلى الله عليه وآله فترك يومئذ " حي على خير العمل " (1).
 وفي الفقيه أيضا: روي منصور بن حازم عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال: هبط  جبرئيل عليه السلام بالاذان على رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله وكان رأسه في حجر علي عليه السلام فأذن جبرئيل  عليه السلام وأقام، فلما انتبه رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله قال: يا علي سمعت؟ قال: نعم يا  رسول الله  فقال: حفظت؟ قال: نعم قال: ادع بلا لا فعلمه، فدعا بلا لا فعلمه (2).
 أسامة بن زيد  قال الشيخ رحمه الله تعالى في كتاب الرجال في باب الصحابة: أسامة بن زيد بن  شراحيل مولى رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله أمه أم أيمن اسمها بركة مولاة رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله كنيته  أبو محمد، ويقال: أبو زيد (3).
 شراحيل بفتح الشين المعجمة وكسر الحاء المهملة.
 وقال في باب أصحاب أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام: أسامة بن زيد بن حارثة مولى  رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله، والأصل من كليب ونسبه معروف (4).
footnote: (١) من لا يحضره الفقيه: ١ / ١٨٤ ٢) من لا يحضره الفقيه: ١ / 183 3) رجال الشيخ: 3 4) رجال الشيخ: 34

'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) said, "Bilal was a righteous servant, and Suhayb was a bad servant; he used to weep for 'Umar."
Usama ibn Zayd 80 - Muhammad ibn Mas'ud narrated to us, he said: Ali ibn Muhammad narrated to me, he said: Muhammad narrated to me ____________________
His saying (peace be upon him): "Bilal was a righteous servant." Al-Saduq Abu Ja'far Ibn Babawayh (may God's grace be upon him) narrated in *Al-Faqih* from Abi Basir, from one of the two of them (peace be upon them), that he said: "Bilal was a righteous servant," so he said: "I will not give the call to prayer for anyone after the Messenger of God (may God bless him and his family)," and he left out on that day "Hayya 'ala khayr al-'amal" (Hasten to the best of deeds) (1).
Also in *Al-Faqih*: It was narrated that Mansur ibn Hazim said, from Abi 'Abd Allah (peace be upon him) said: Gabriel (peace be upon him) descended with the Adhan (call to prayer) upon the Messenger of God (may God bless him and his family), and his head was in the lap of Ali (peace be upon him). Gabriel (peace be upon him) gave the Adhan and the Iqama. When the Messenger of God (may God bless him and his family) awoke, he said: "O Ali, did you hear?" He said: "Yes, O Messenger of God." He said: "Did you memorize it?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Call Bilal and teach him." So he called Bilal and taught him (2).
Usama ibn Zayd
The Sheikh (may God have mercy on him) said in the book of *Al-Rijal* in the chapter on the Companions: "Usama ibn Zayd ibn Sharahil, freed slave of the Messenger of God (may God bless him and his family), his mother is Umm Ayman, her name is Baraka, freed slave of the Messenger of God (may God bless him and his family), his kunya is Abu Muhammad, and it is said: Abu Zayd (3)."
Sharahil: with a fatha on the letter shin and a kasra on the letter ha.
And he said in the chapter on the companions of Amir al-Mu'minin (peace be upon him): "Usama ibn Zayd ibn Haritha, freed slave of the Messenger of God (may God bless him and his family), and the origin is from Kulayb, and his lineage is known (4)."

text:
ابن أحمد، عن سهل بن زاذويه، عن أيوب بن نوح، عمن رواه، عن أبي مريم الأنصاري، عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: إن الحسن بن علي عليه السلام كفن أسامة بن زيد في برد أحمر حبرة.
____________________
 وقال ابن عبد البر: أبو محمد أسامة بن زيد بن حارثة الحب بن الحب، أمه أم  أيمن، وهاجر مع رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله، وكان النبي يحبه حبا شديدا، واستعمله وهو ابن  ثماني عشرة سنة (1).
 وفي مختصر الذهبي: أسامة بن زيد بن حارثة حب رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله وابن حبه،  مات 54، الحب بالكسر المحبوب.
 وفي الصحاح والقاموس: شراحيل لا ينصرف عند سيبويه في معرفة ولا نكرة،  لأنه بزنة جمع الجمع، وعند الأخفش ينصرف في النكرة فإذا حقرته انصرف عندها  لأنه عربي، وفارق السراويل لأنها أعجمية (2).
 فقد علم مما ذكرنا أن والد أسامة بن زيد زيد بن حارثة بن شراحيل الكلبي -  وليس هو زيد بن حارثة الأوسي الأنصاري.
 ذكره الشيخ أيضا في باب الصحابة وقال: وليس بأبي أسامة بن زيد (3).
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: عمن رواه عن أبي مريم الأنصاري  وهو عبد الغفار الجازي، وقد سبق في ترجمة سهل بن حنيف.
 والشيخ رحمه الله في التهذيب روى هذا الحديث عن أيوب بن نوح عمن  رواه عن أبي مريم الأنصاري، كما رواه أبو عمرو الكشي، ورواه أيضا بسند متصل  صحيح عن أحمد بن محمد بن عيسى عن محمد بن إسماعيل بن بزيع عن علي بن

Ibn Ahmad, from Sahl ibn Zadhawaih, from Ayyub ibn Nuh, from someone who narrated it, from Abi Maryam al-Ansari, from Abi Jaafar (peace be upon him) who said: "Al-Hasan ibn Ali (peace be upon him) shrouded Usama ibn Zaid in a red Hibra cloak."
____________________
Ibn Abd al-Barr said: "Abu Muhammad Usama ibn Zaid ibn Haritha, the beloved son of the beloved, his mother was Umm Ayman, and he emigrated with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him and his family). The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) loved him very much, and appointed him when he was eighteen years old (1)."
In the summary of al-Dhahabi: "Usama ibn Zaid ibn Haritha, the beloved of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and the son of his beloved, died in 54 AH. Al-Hubb (the beloved) with a kasra means the beloved."
In al-Sahah and al-Qamus: "Sharāhīl does not decline according to Sibawayh in definite or indefinite form, because it is in the weight of the جمع الجمع (plural of plurals), and according to al-Akhfash, it declines in the indefinite form, so if you diminutive it, it declines according to him because it is Arabic, and it differs from 'sarāwīl' (trousers) because it is non-Arabic (2)."
It is known from what we mentioned that the father of Usama ibn Zaid is Zaid ibn Haritha ibn Sharahil al-Kalbi - and he is not Zaid ibn Haritha al-Awsi al-Ansari.
The Sheikh also mentioned him in the chapter on the Companions and said: "He is not the father of Usama ibn Zaid (3)."
His saying (may Allah have mercy on him): "from someone who narrated it from Abi Maryam al-Ansari," and he is Abd al-Ghaffar al-Jazi, and it has already been mentioned in the biography of Sahl ibn Hunayf.
And the Sheikh (may Allah have mercy on him) in al-Tahdhib narrated this hadith from Ayyub ibn Nuh from someone who narrated it from Abi Maryam al-Ansari, as Abu Amr al-Kashshi narrated it, and he also narrated it with a connected and sahih (authentic) isnad (chain of narration) from Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Isa from Muhammad ibn Ismail ibn Bazi' from Ali ibn

text:
81 - محمد بن مسعود، قال أحمد بن منصور، عن أحمد بن الفضل، عن محمد بن زياد، عن سلمة بن محرز، عن أبي جعفر عليه السلام قال: ألا أخبركم بأهل ____________________
 نعمان عن أبي مريم الأنصاري قال: سمعت أبا جعفر يقول الحديث (1).
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: أحمد بن منصور عن أحمد بن الفضل  محمد بن منصور بن نصر الخزاعي من أصحاب أبي الحسن الرضا عليه السلام يقال  له: أحمد بن منصور، وقد نقلنا ذلك فيما سبق عن الشيخ في كتاب الرجال.
 وأحمد بن الفضل الخزاعي من أصحاب أبي الحسن الكاظم عليه السلام واقفي قاله  الشيخ أيضا في كتاب الرجال (2).
 فالطريق به ضعيف ولو لاه لكان الطريق قويا بأحمد بن منصور وبسملة بن  محرز (3) القلانسي الكوفي أيضا، وهو من أصحاب أبي جعفر الباقر وأبي عبد الله  الصادق عليهما السلام.
 وأما محمد بن زياد وهو محمد بن الحسن بن زياد العطار يقال له: محمد  بن زياد ثقة (4).
 قال العلامة في الخلاصة: قال الكشي: روي أنه رجع ونهينا أن نقول الا خيرا  في طريق ضعيف، ذكرناه في كتابنا الكبير، ثم قال: والأولى عندي الوقف في  روايته (5).
 قلت: لابل الأولى قبول روايته لصحيحة أبي مريم الأنصاري من طريق  التهذيب في تكفين مولانا أبي محمد الحسن عليه السلام إياه (6)، وسائر الروايات المتعاضدة
footnote: (١) تهذيب الأحكام: ١ / ٢٩٦ ٢) رجال الشيخ: ٣٤٤ ٣) بضم الميم واسكان الحاء المهملة وكسر الراء والزاء أخيرا " منه " ٤) راجع رجال النجاشي: ٢٨٥ ٥) الخلاصة: ٢٣ ٦) تهذيب الأحكام: ١ / 296

81 - Muhammad ibn Mas'ud, said Ahmad ibn Mansur, from Ahmad ibn al-Fadl, from Muhammad ibn Ziyad, from Salama ibn Muhriz, from Abi Ja'far (peace be upon him) who said: "Shall I not inform you about the people of...
Nu'man from Abi Maryam al-Ansari said: I heard Abu Ja'far saying the Hadith (1)."
His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: Ahmad ibn Mansur from Ahmad ibn al-Fadl. Muhammad ibn Mansur ibn Nasr al-Khuza'i, one of the companions of Abi al-Hasan al-Ridha (peace be upon him), is called Ahmad ibn Mansur, and we have mentioned this previously from al-Shaykh in the book of Rijāl.
And Ahmad ibn al-Fadl al-Khuza'i is one of the companions of Abi al-Hasan al-Kazim (peace be upon him), a Waqifi, as al-Shaykh also said in the book of Rijāl (2).
Thus, the chain is da'īf (weak) because of him, and if it weren't for him, the chain would be strong because of Ahmad ibn Mansur and because of Salama ibn Muhriz (3) al-Qalanisi al-Kufi as well, and he is one of the companions of Abi Ja'far al-Baqir and Abi Abd Allah al-Sadiq (peace be upon them).
As for Muhammad ibn Ziyad, he is Muhammad ibn al-Hasan ibn Ziyad al-Attar, and he is called Muhammad ibn Ziyad, thiqa (trustworthy) (4).
Al-'Allama said in al-Khulasa: Al-Kashshi said: It is narrated that he recanted, and we were forbidden to say anything but good in a da'īf (weak) chain, which we mentioned in our large book, then he said: And the best thing in my view is to abstain from his narration (5).
I say: Rather, it is better to accept his narration because of the sahih (authentic) narration of Abi Maryam al-Ansari from the route of al-Tahdhib regarding the shrouding of our master Abi Muhammad al-Hasan (peace be upon him) by him (6), and the other corroborating narrations.

الوقوف، قلنا: بلى. قال أسامة بن زيد وقد رجع فلا تقولوا الا خيرا، ومحمد بن مسلمة، وابن عمر مات منكوبا.
____________________
 في أن أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام قد عذره في الوقوف على متابعته ومبايعته ودعوة الناس  إليه، واظهار أن الحق فيه ومعه وفيما قد وقع منه من الممايلة والمسايرة مع أولئك  الأقوام والمواتاة لهم والمجازات والمماشاة معهم، ونقض الميثاق الذي قد أخذه  منهم رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله يوم الغدير، ومراعاة العهد الذي كان جري بينه وبينهم بعده.
 ولان الشيخ رحمه الله في كتاب الرجال أورده في أصحاب أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام (1)  ولم يطعن (2) له أصلا.
 ولتظافر الاخبار في أنه كان حب رسول ل الله صلى الله عليه وآله وابن حبه (3).
 ومن الصحيح الثابت عند نقلة الاخبار وجملة الروايات أن أسامة بن زيد لم  يبايع أبا بكر حتى مات وقال: رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله أمرني عليك فمن أمرك علي.
 قوله عليه السلام: ومحمد بن مسلمة وابن عمر مات منكوبا  يعنى محمد بن مسلمة أيضا رجع بعد الوقوف كما أسامة، فلا تقولوا فيه  الا خيرا، وابن عمر من أهل الوقوف ولم يرجع ومات منكوبا.
 أو يعني كل منهما مات منكوبا - بالنون قبل الكاف والباء الموحدة بعد الواو -  أي معد ولا به عن طريق الحق وعن سبيل الاستقامة.
 يقال: نكب عن الطريق إذا عدل عنه: ونكب به عنه غيره ونكبه عنه تنكيبا  إذ أحرفه وأزاغه عنه، وطريق منكوب على غير قصد واستقامة.
 محمد بن مسلمة ذكره الشيخ رحمه الله تعالى في باب الصحابة (4).

translation:
T Text:

regarding al-Wuqūf (remaining neutral), we said: Yes. Usama ibn Zaid said, having returned [to allegiance], "Do not say except good [words]." And Muhammad ibn Maslama and Ibn Umar died *mankūban* (afflicted).
____________________
[This is] because the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, excused him for al-Wuqūf (remaining neutral) regarding following him, pledging allegiance to him, and calling people to him, and declaring that the truth was in him and with him, and concerning what had occurred from him in terms of leaning and siding with those people, agreeing with them, compromising, and going along with them, and violating the covenant that the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, had taken from them on the Day of Ghadeer, and observing the agreement that had taken place between him and them after that.
For the Sheikh, may God have mercy on him, in the book *al-Rijāl* (Biographical Evaluation of Narrators), mentioned him among the companions of the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him (1), and did not discredit (2) him at all.
And due to the abundance of reports that he was the beloved of the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, and the son of his beloved (3).
And it is authentically established according to narrators of reports and the entirety of narrations that Usama ibn Zaid did not pledge allegiance to Abu Bakr until he died, and he said: “The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, appointed me over you, so who appointed you over me?”
His saying, peace be upon him: “And Muhammad ibn Maslama and Ibn Umar died *mankūban* (afflicted)” means that Muhammad ibn Maslama also returned [to allegiance] after al-Wuqūf (remaining neutral), like Usama, so do not say about him except good [words]. And Ibn Umar was from the people of al-Wuqūf (remaining neutral) and did not return [to allegiance] and died *mankūban* (afflicted).
Or it means that each of them died *mankūban* (deviated) – with a *nūn* before the *kāf* and a *bā’ muwaḥḥada* after the *wāw* – meaning turned away from the path of truth and the way of rectitude.
It is said: *Nakaba ʿan al-ṭarīq* (he deviated from the path) when he turned away from it. And *Nakaba bihi ʿanhu ghayruhu* (someone else diverted him from it), and *nakabahu ʿanhu tankīban* (he diverted him from it with a deflection) when he displaced him and turned him away from it. And *ṭarīq mankūb* (a deflected path) is one that is not intended or straight.
Muhammad ibn Maslama was mentioned by the Sheikh, may God have mercy on him, in the chapter on the Companions (4).

____________________
 وفي جامع الأصول: هو أبو عبد الله وقيل: أبو عبد الرحمن محمد بن مسلمة  ابن خالد بن مجدعة بن الحارث بن عمرو بن ملك بن أوس الأنصاري الحارثي  الأشهلي، وقيل: في نسبه غير ذلك.
 شهد المشاهد كلها الا في تبوك، وكان من فضلاء الصحابة، وكان من الذين  أسلموا على يد مصعب بن عمر بالمدينة، ومات بها سنة ثلاث، وقيل: ست، وقيل:
 سبع وأربعين، وهو ابن سبع وسبعين سنة، وفي نسبة خلاف غير ما قيل أولا.
 مجدعة بفتح الميم وسكون الجيم وفتح الدال المهملة.
 وفي مختصر الذهبي: محمد بن مسلمة الخزرجي بدري جليل، مات في عشر  ثمانين بالمدينة سنة 43.
 " ابن عمر " هو عبد الله بن عمر بن الخطاب ذكره الشيخ رحمه الله في  الصحابة (1).
 وفي جامع الأصول: أسلم مع أبيه بمكة وهو صغير، وقد ذهب قوم إلى أنه  أسلم قبل أبيه ولم يصح، ولم يشهد بدرا واختلفوا في شهوده أحدا.
 والصحيح أن أول مشاهده الخندق وقيل: إنه استصغر يوم بدر وأجازه النبي  صلى الله عليه وآله يوم أحد، وروى نافع أنه رده يوم أحد لأنه كان ابن أربع عشر سنة، وشهد  ما بعد الخندق من المشاهد، وكان من أهل الورع والعلم والزهد شديد التحري  والاحتياط والتوقي في فتياه.
 ولد قبل الوحي بسنة، ومات بمكة سنة ثلاث وسبعين بعد قتل ابن الزبير  بثلاثة أشهر وقيل: بسنة أشهر، ودفن بذي طوى في مقبرة المهاجرين، وقيل: دفن  بفخ، وله أربع وثمانون سنة، وقيل: ستة وثمانون، روى عنه خلق كثير، منهم ابناه  سالم وحمزة ونافع مولاه انتهى كلام جامع الأصول.

And in Jami' al-Usul: He is Abu Abdullah, and it was said: Abu Abd al-Rahman Muhammad ibn Maslama ibn Khalid ibn Majda'a ibn al-Harith ibn 'Amr ibn Malik ibn Aws al-Ansari al-Harithi al-Ashhali, and it was said: otherwise regarding his lineage.
He witnessed all the battles except for Tabuk, and he was among the virtuous Companions, and he was among those who embraced Islam at the hands of Mus'ab ibn 'Umar in Medina, and he died there in the year three, and it was said: six, and it was said:
forty-seven, and he was seventy-seven years old, and there is disagreement in his lineage other than what was said first.
Majda'a with a fatha on the mim, a sukun on the jim, and a fatha on the unpointed dal.
And in Mukhtasar al-Dhahabi: Muhammad ibn Maslama al-Khazraji, a great Badri, died in the decade of the eighties in Medina in the year 43.
"Ibn 'Umar" is Abdullah ibn 'Umar ibn al-Khattab, whom al-Shaykh (may God have mercy on him) mentioned among the Companions (1).
And in Jami' al-Usul: He embraced Islam with his father in Mecca when he was young, and some people have gone to the opinion that he embraced Islam before his father, but it is not correct, and they differed regarding his witnessing of Badr, and they differed about his witnessing Uhud.
The correct view is that his first battle was al-Khandaq, and it was said: that he was considered too young on the day of Badr, and the Prophet (peace and blessings of God be upon him) permitted him on the day of Uhud, and Nafi' narrated that he turned him back on the day of Uhud because he was fourteen years old, and he witnessed the battles after al-Khandaq, and he was among the people of piety, knowledge, and asceticism, extremely diligent, cautious, and careful in his legal verdicts (fatwa).
He was born a year before the Revelation, and died in Mecca in the year seventy-three, three months after the killing of Ibn al-Zubayr, and it was said: a year and several months, and he was buried in Dhi Tuwa in the cemetery of the Muhajirin, and it was said: he was buried in Fakh, and he was eighty-four years old, and it was said: eighty-six, and a great many people narrated from him, including his two sons Salim and Hamza and Nafi', his mawla (freed slave). End of the words of Jami' al-Usul.

text:
82 - قال أبو عمرو الكشي: وجدت في كتاب أبي عبد الله الشاذاني، قال حدثني جعفر بن محمد المدايني، عن موسى بن القاسم العجلي، عن صفوان، عن عبد الرحمن بن الحجاج، عن أبي عبد الله، عن آبائه عليهما السلام قال: كتب علي عليه السلام إلى والي المدينة لا تعطين سعدا ولا ابن عمر من الفئ شيئا، فأما أسامة بن زيد ____________________
 ومن تعاجيب الأوهام الفاسدة لبعض من أدرك عصرنا حسبانه أن ابن عمر في  هذا الحديث هو الذي تقدم أنه قال لمعاوية يوم قتل عمار بن ياسر رضي الله تعالى  عنه: اني معكم ولست أقاتل ان أبي شكاني إلى النبي صلى الله عليه وآله فقال لي رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله  " أطع أباك ما دام حيا ولا تعصه " فأنا معكم ولست أقاتل (1).
 فيا عجبا لهذا المتوهم كيف اعتراه هذا الحسبان، ولم يعلم أن ذاك عبد الله  بن عمرو بن العاص كان في معسكر معاوية مع أبيه، وذا عبد الله بن عمر بن الخطاب  فارق معسكر معاوية إذ شاهد قتل عمار، لقول النبي صلى الله عليه وآله: تقتله الفئة الباغية. ولم  يرجع إلى أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام بل خرج من عند معاوية منصرفا إلى الحجاز وأقام بمكة  إلى أن توفى بها.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: وجدت في كتاب أبي عبد الله الشاذاني  وهو محمد بن أحمد بن نعيم النيسابوري الشاذاني - بالمعجمتين والنون -  من أصحاب أبي محمد العسكري عليه السلام، أنفذ بما اجتمع عنده من مال الغريم إليه عليه السلام  وزاده من ماله، فورد عليه الجواب منه عليه السلام قد وصل إلي ما أنفذت إلى من خاصة  مالك وهو كذا وكذا تقبل الله منك.
 قوله عليه السلام: لا تعطين سعدا ولا ابن عمر ومن الفئ شيئا  يعني سعد بن أبي وقاص وعبد الله بن عمر.
 قال المسعودي في مروج الذهب: حدث أبو جعفر محمد بن جرير الطبري،

82 - Abu Amr al-Kashshi said: I found in the book of Abu Abdullah al-Shadhani, who said: Jaafar bin Muhammad al-Madaini narrated to me, from Musa bin al-Qasim al-Ajli, from Safwan, from Abd al-Rahman bin al-Hajjaj, from Abi Abdullah, from his forefathers, peace be upon them, who said: Ali, peace be upon him, wrote to the governor of Medina, "Do not give Sa'd nor Ibn Umar anything from the fay' (spoils of war)," As for Usama bin Zaid ____________________
And among the wonders of the corrupt illusions of some who lived in our time is his belief that Ibn Umar in this hadith is the one who said to Muawiya on the day Ammar bin Yasir, may God Almighty be pleased with him, was killed: "I am with you but I will not fight. My father complained about me to the Prophet, may God bless him and his family, and the Messenger of God, may God bless him and his family, said to me, "Obey your father as long as he is alive and do not disobey him," so I am with you but I will not fight (1).
How strange is this illusion that has befallen this deluded person, not knowing that that was Abdullah bin Amr bin al-Aas, who was in Muawiya's camp with his father, and this is Abdullah bin Umar bin al-Khattab, who left Muawiya's camp when he witnessed the killing of Ammar, because of the Prophet's saying, peace and blessings be upon him: "A rebellious group will kill him." He did not return to the Commander of the Faithful, peace be upon him, but left Muawiya and went to the Hijaz and stayed in Mecca until he died there.
His saying, may God have mercy on him: I found in the book of Abi Abdullah al-Shadhani, who is Muhammad bin Ahmad bin Naim al-Nisaburi al-Shadhani - with two dotted letters and a nun - one of the companions of Abi Muhammad al-Askari, peace be upon him. He sent what he had collected of the debtor's money to him, peace be upon him, and added to it from his own money. The response came to him from him, peace be upon him, "What you sent to me from your own money has reached me, which is such and such, may God accept it from you."
His saying, peace be upon him: "Do not give Sa'd nor Ibn Umar anything from the fay'" meaning Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas and Abdullah bin Umar.
Al-Masoudi said in Muruj al-Dhahab: Abu Jaafar Muhammad bin Jarir al-Tabari narrated,

 عن محمد بن حميد الرازي، عن أبي مجاهد، عن محمد بن إسحاق، عن ابن أبي  نجيح، قال: لما حج معاوية طاف بالبيت ومعه سعد، فلما فرغ انصرف معاوية إلى  دار الندوة وأجلسه معه على سريره ووقع في علي عليه السلام وشرع في سبه، فزحف سعد.
 ثم قال: أجلستني معك علي سريرك، ثم شرعت في سب علي، والله لا ن تكون  لي خصلة واحدة من خصال كانت لعلي أحب إلي من أن يكون لي ما طلعت عليه  الشمس، والله لان أكون صهر رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله وأن لي من الولد ما لعلي أحب إلي من  أن يكون لي ما طلعت عليه الشمس.
 والله لا يكون رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله قال لي ما قال له يوم خيبر: " لأعطين الراية  رجلا يحبه الله ورسوله ويحب الله ورسوله كرارا ليس بفرار يفتح الله على يديه "  أحب إلي من أن يكون لي ما طلعت عليه الشمس.
 والله لان يكون صلى الله عليه وآله قال لي ما قال له في غزوة تبوك: " ألا ترضى أن تكون مني  بمنزلة هارون من موسى الا أنه لا نبي بعدي " أحب إلي من أن يكون لي ما طلعت  عليه الشمس، وأيم الله لا دخلت لك دارا ما بقيت ثم نهض.
 ووجدت في وجه آخر من الروايات أن سعدا لما قال لمعاوية هذه المقالة ثم  نهض ليقوم قال له معاوية: فهلا نصرته؟ ولم تكن قعدت عن بيعته.
 وكان سعد وأسامة بن زيد وعبد الله بن عمر ومحمد بن مسلمة ممن قعد عن  بيعة علي بن أبي طالب، وأبوا أن يبايعوه، وغيرهم مما ذكرنا من القعود عن بيعته،  وذلك أنهم قالوا: إنها فتنة انتهى كلام مروج الذهب (1).
 وقد ذكر قبل هذا الكلام نقلا عن أبي مخنف لوط بن يحيى وغيره أن هؤلاء  المتخلفين قد رجعوا إليه أخيرا وبايعوه عليه السلام جميعا
footnote: (1) مروج الذهب: 3 / 14

From Muhammad ibn Humayd al-Razi, from Abi Mujahid, from Muhammad ibn Ishaq, from Ibn Abi Nujayh, who said: When Mu'awiya performed Hajj, he circumambulated the House with Sa'd. When he finished, Mu'awiya went to Dar al-Nadwa, seated him with him on his throne, and began to disparage Ali (peace be upon him) and started cursing him. Sa'd became agitated.
Then he said: "You seated me with you on your throne, then you began to curse Ali? By God, that I should have one quality of the qualities that Ali had is more beloved to me than everything the sun has ever shone upon. By God, that I were the son-in-law of the Messenger of God (may God bless him and his family) and that I had children like Ali, is more beloved to me than everything the sun has ever shone upon.
By God, that the Messenger of God (may God bless him and his family) should have said to me what he said to him on the day of Khaybar: 'I will give the banner to a man who loves God and His Messenger, and whom God and His Messenger love, a repeated attacker, not a runaway, through whose hands God will grant victory,' is more beloved to me than everything the sun has ever shone upon.
By God, that he (may God bless him and his family) should have said to me what he said to him in the Battle of Tabuk: 'Are you not pleased to be to me as Aaron was to Moses, except that there will be no prophet after me,' is more beloved to me than everything the sun has ever shone upon. By God, I will never enter a house of yours as long as I live." Then he stood up.
And I found in another version of the narrations that when Sa'd said this statement to Mu'awiya, then stood up to leave, Mu'awiya said to him: "Then why did you not support him? And why did you sit out from pledging allegiance to him?"
Sa'd, Usama ibn Zayd, Abdullah ibn Umar, and Muhammad ibn Muslima were among those who sat out from pledging allegiance to Ali ibn Abi Talib and refused to pledge allegiance to him, as well as others whom we mentioned as having refrained from pledging allegiance to him, because they said: "It is a fitna (trial/tribulation)." This is the end of the words of Muruj al-Dhahab (The Meadows of Gold) (1).
It was mentioned before this statement, quoting Abu Mikhnaf Lut ibn Yahya and others, that these who held back ultimately returned to him and pledged allegiance to him, peace be upon him, all of them.

text:
____________________
 رسول الله صلى الله عليه وآله يقول لعلي عليه السلام حربك حربي وسلمك سلمي وأنك تقاتل بعدي  الناكثين والقاسطين والمارقين، وغير ذلك مما سد على المتخلفين باب الاعتذار،  ولكن العذر عند كرام الناس مقبول، ومولانا أمير المؤمنين صلوات الله وتسليماته عليه  أعلم بالقضايا والاحكام فليعلم (1)  أبو سعيد الخدري  ذكره الشيخ رحمه الله في الصحابة قال: سعد أبو سعيد الخدري (2)، ثم ذكره  في أصحاب أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام قال: سعد بن مالك الخزرجي يكنى أبا سعيد الخدري  الأنصاري العربي المدني (3).
 وأبو الحسن المسعودي أورده في عداد الذين قعدوا وتثبطوا عن بيعة  أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام، ثم ذكر أنهم رجعوا إليه عليه السلام واعتذروا وبايعوا جميعا.
 " الخدري " بضم الخاء وسكون الدال المهملة منسوب إلى خدرة، واسمه الأبحر  ابن عوف بن حارث، وقيل: خدرة أم أبحر والأول أشهر، وهم بطن من الأنصار كذا  في جامع الأصول.
 وفي المغرب: خدرة بالسكون حي من العرب إليهم ينسب أبو سعيد الخدري.
 قال ابن عبد البر: أبو سعيد سعد بن مالك بن سنان بن ثعلبة الخدري، قال  أبو سعيد: عرضت يوم أحد على النبي صلى الله عليه وآله وأنا ابن ثلاث عشرة فجعل أبي يأخذ  بيدي فيقول: يا رسول الله انه عبل العظام وإن كان مؤدنا أي قصيرا، وجعل النبي صلى الله عليه وآله  يصعد في ويصوب.
footnote:
(1) هذه التعليقة توجد في نسخة " م " فقط، بخط السيد الداماد رحمه الله.
2) رجال الشيخ: 20 3) رجال الشيخ: 43
translation:
T Text:
---
The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, said to Ali, peace be upon him, "Your war is my war, and your peace is my peace, and you will fight after me the Nākithīn (those who break their oath), the Qāsitīn (the unjust), and the Māriqīn (those who deviate from religion)," and other things that closed the door of excuse for those who lagged behind. But the excuse is acceptable to the generous people, and our master, the Commander of the Believers, may God’s blessings and peace be upon him, knows best the matters and rulings, so let Abu Sa'id al-Khudri know.

The Sheikh, may God have mercy on him, mentioned him among the Companions, saying: Sa'd Abu Sa'id al-Khudri. Then he mentioned him among the companions of the Commander of the Believers, peace be upon him, saying: Sa'd ibn Malik al-Khazraji, known as Abu Sa'id al-Khudri al-Ansari al-Arabi al-Madani.

Abu al-Hasan al-Mas'udi mentioned him among those who sat back and were hesitant about pledging allegiance to the Commander of the Believers, peace be upon him. Then he mentioned that they returned to him, peace be upon him, apologized, and pledged allegiance all together.

"Al-Khudri" with a ḍamma on the Khāʾ and a sukūn on the Dāl, attributed to Khudra, and his name is al-Abhar ibn Awf ibn Harith, and it was said: Khudra is the mother of Abhar, and the first is more famous, and they are a clan of the Ansar, as in Jami al-Usul.

And in al-Maghrib: Khudra with a sukūn is a tribe of the Arabs to whom Abu Sa'id al-Khudri is attributed.

Ibn Abd al-Barr said: Abu Sa'id Sa'd ibn Malik ibn Sinan ibn Tha'laba al-Khudri. Abu Sa'id said: I was presented to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, on the day of Uhud, and I was thirteen years old, and my father began to take my hand, saying: O Messenger of God, he is 'abl al-'izam (strong-boned), even if he is mu'din (short), and the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him and his family, would look up and down at me.

text:
أبو سعيد الخدري 83 - حمدويه، قال حدثنا أيوب، عن عبد الله بن المغيرة، قال حدثني ذريع عن أبي عبد الله عليه السلام قال، ذكر أبو سعيد الخدري، فقال: كان من أصحاب رسول الله ____________________
 ثم قال: رده فردني فخرجنا نتلقى رسول الله حين أقبل من أحد، فنظر إلي  فقال: سعد بن مالك؟ قلت: نعم يأبي وأمي، فدنوت فقبلت ركبته، فقال: آجرك  الله في أبيك وكان قتل يومئذ شهيدا.
 توفي أبو سعيد في يوم الجمعة سنة أربع وسبعين ودفن بالبقيع، وهو ابن أربع  وتسعين (1).
 قال الذهبي: سعد بن مالك أبو سعد الخدري من أصحاب الشجرة فقيه،  عنه ابن المسيب وأبو بصيرة، توفي 74.
 قلت: أبو سعيد الخدري كان على الاستقامة ومات على الاستقامة، شهد الجمل  والصفين والنهروان، وهو ممن يروي حديث المارقة الخوارج، ووصف المخدج  ذي الثدية منهم، وقتله يوم النهروان على صفته التي كان يخبر بها أمير المؤمنين عليه السلام  قوله رحمه الله تعالى: قال حدثني ذريح  هو أبو الوليد ذريح - باعجام الذال المفتوحة وكسر الراء واسكان الياء المثناة  من تحت واهمال الحاء أخيرا - ابن محمد بن يزيد المحاربي عربي من بني محارب  بن خصفة.
 ذكره الشيخ في كتاب الرجال في أصحاب الصادق عليه السلام (2). وقال في  الفهرست: ثقة له أصل (3).
footnote: (١) الإستيعاب لابن عبد البر مطبوع على هامش الإصابة: ٤ / ٨٩ ٢) رجال الشيخ: ١٩١ ٣) الفهرست: ٩٥
translation:

Abu Sa'id al-Khudri 83 - Hamdawayh, said: Ayyub narrated to us, from Abdullah ibn al-Mughira, who said: Dhari narrated to me from Abi Abdullah, peace be upon him, who said: Abu Sa'id al-Khudri was mentioned, and he said: He was one of the companions of the Messenger of Allah ____________________.
Then he said: He called me back, so I returned, and we went out to meet the Messenger of Allah when he was returning from Uhud. He looked at me and said: "Sa'd ibn Malik?" I said: "Yes, may my father and mother be sacrificed for you." So I approached and kissed his knee, and he said: "May Allah reward you for your father," who was killed as a martyr that day.
Abu Sa'id died on a Friday in the year seventy-four, and he was buried in al-Baqi', and he was ninety-four years old (1).
Al-Dhahabi said: Sa'd ibn Malik Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, one of the companions of the Tree, a jurist, from whom Ibn al-Musayyib and Abu Basir narrated, died in 74.
I say: Abu Sa'id al-Khudri was upon uprightness and died upon uprightness. He witnessed al-Jamal, Siffin, and al-Nahrawan, and he is one of those who narrate the hadith of the Kharijites who deviated from the religion, and he described the man with the deflated breast among them, and he killed him on the day of al-Nahrawan according to the description that Amir al-Mu'minin, peace be upon him, used to tell about.
His saying, may Allah have mercy on him: He said Dhuray narrated to me - he is Abu al-Walid Dhuray - with a dot on the open "dhal," a kasra on the "ra," a silent "ya" with two dots underneath, and neglecting the "ha" at the end - ibn Muhammad ibn Yazid al-Muharibi, an Arab from the tribe of Muharib ibn Khasafa.
Al-Shaykh mentioned him in the book of *al-Rijal* among the companions of al-Sadiq, peace be upon him (2). And he said in *al-Fihrist*: *thiqa* (trustworthy) , he has an *asl* (foundational text) (3).

text:
وكان مستقيما، قال: فنزع ثلاثة أيام فغسله أهله ثم حملوه إلى مصلاه فمات فيه.
84 - محمد بن مسعود، قال حدثني الحسين بن أشكيب، ____________________
 والعلامة في الخلاصة نقل عن الشيخ توثيقه (1)، ولست أجد في الاخبار  لتوثيقه مستندا.
 والنجاشي لم يوثقه وقال: روى عن أبي عبد الله وأبي الحسن عليهما السلام ذكره ابن  عقده وابن نوح له كتاب يرويه عدة من أصحابنا (2) وانما ذلك ضرب من المدح.
 قال السيد جمال الدين أحمد بن طاوس في اختياره من كتاب الكشي: لم أجد  فيه ما يوصف به من مدح له طائل أو ذم في هذا الكتاب.
 قلت: وسنتلو عليك حق القول فيه حيث يحين حينه في ترجمته انشاء الله  العزيز، والآن نقول طريق هذا الحديث صحيح أو حسن بذريح المحاربي.
 قوله عليه السلام: وكان مستقيما  أي كان حنيف الدين مستقيم المذهب قويم الاعتقاد، واشتد عليه النزع ثلاثة  أيام فغسله أهله.
 اما بالتخفيف أي غسلوه من الاقذار أي وضؤوه تولوا وضوءه، أي تولوا وضوءه، تعبيرا عن  الوضوء بالغسل الذي هو أول أجزائه.
 واما بالتثقيل من التغسيل، أي تولوا ما كان عليه من غسل الجنابة، ثم حملوه  إلى مصلاه، وذلك من السنن المأثورة، فمات رضي الله تعالى عنه.
 قوله رحمه الله تعالى: قال حدثنا الحسين بن اشكيب  الحسين بالتصغير، وأشكيب بالاعجام بعد الهمزة، وقيل: بالاهمال، والحسين  هو خادم القبر.
footnote: (١) الخلاصة: ٧٠ ٢) رجال النجاشي: ١٢٤
translation:
T Text:
---
He was upright. He said: He suffered for three days, then his family washed him and carried him to his prayer place, and he died there.
84 - Muhammad bin Mas'ud, said: Al-Hussein bin Ashkib narrated to me, ____________________
And the sign in al-Khulasa mentioned the Sheikh's authentication of him (1), but I do not find a basis for his authentication in the narrations.
Al-Najashi did not authenticate him and said: He narrated from Abi Abdullah and Abi al-Hasan, peace be upon them. Ibn Uqdah and Ibn Nuh mentioned him, and he has a book narrated by several of our companions (2), and that is just a form of praise.
Sayyid Jamal al-Din Ahmad bin Tawus said in his selection from the book of al-Kashshi: I did not find in it anything that describes him, whether praise of significance or criticism, in this book.
I say: And we will recite to you the truth about him when its time comes in his biography, God Almighty willing. And now we say the chain of this hadith is ṣaḥīḥ (authentic) or ḥasan (good) due to Dharih al-Muharibi.
His saying, peace be upon him: "He was upright" means he was ḥanīf (a follower of pure monotheism), upright in his religion, sound in belief, and the suffering was severe on him for three days, so his family washed him.
Either with takhfif (lightening), meaning they washed him of impurities, meaning they performed his ablution, they took care of his ablution, expressing the ablution with washing, which is the first of its parts.
Or with tashdid (emphasis) from al-taghsīl, meaning they took care of what he was obliged to do of ghusl (ritual bath) due to janabah (state of impurity), then they carried him to his prayer place, and that is from the Sunan (customs) handed down, so he died, may God be pleased with him.
His saying, may God have mercy on him: Hussein bin Ashkib narrated to us. Al-Hussein with tasghir (diminutive form), and Ashkib with i'jam (dots) after the hamza, and it was said: with ihmal (no dots), and Al-Hussein is the servant of the grave.
